description:
For what it is, it's an above average traditional diner. Has all the traditional food fare for breakfast and brunch with a few extra twists. Definitely enjoyed the espresso milkshake; if you get the chance and like espresso and milkshakes I suggest you give it a try.

The service here was good too, the wait staff while only having one person on, made regular rounds to check on us and was pleasant, not overly cheerful but more than polite enough. They were happy to make a minor alteration to my French toast and add banana and the French toast itself was cooked properly crisp on the edges and soft in the middle. Also important to note, the price is more than reasonable for what you get.
author: Anthony S.

description:
I can't believe this place is STILL there and barely changed from when I used to WASH DISHES there back in my mid-teens (1978).

Good, basic breakfast and lunch menu, with decent prices and nothing fancy. I always judge breakfast joints by their basic eggs and hash browns and Rain Tree doesn't disappoint. Their corned beef hash is decent, as is their Irish breakfast (which you don't see on many menus these days).

One bonus is that it's rarely, if ever, crowded. In SF, this is the equivalent of getting on an LA freeway with no traffic, so add a star for that alone.
author: Ian And Alicia D.

description:
Yeah, I don't agree with the 2.5 stars and am actually surprised at the rating. I thought the service was awesome and the food was pretty good.

I ordered the #1 Rain Tree Special - Blueberry Pancakes ($10.75) and also ordered a glass of fresh squeeze orange juice. The plate included 2 pieces of sausage, 2 eggs, and 2 pancakes. The pancakes could have been more fluffy & would have been better with less air bubbles, but they did a good job with the sunny side up eggs. The orange juice was super refreshing and I'd recommend ordering one.

We also got the popeye omelette. Nothing spectacular about it, but they were accommodating and let us put extra ingredients on it.   

They take credit cards, but would prefer to take cash.
author: Victor L.

description: My veggie omelette was very small and tasteless. They mix veggies and avocados in egg batter instead of filling it. I ordered an avocado for extra $1.95 or so. What I got was smears of oxidized (dark turned) avocado in my omelette. I had to search for signs of avocado. When I asked why so little avocado and why dark/oxidize, the waitress said all avocados are like that and I can pay again if I want more added.  What triggered this review is the attitude the waitress had. Not only the attitude, she along with the cook and a guest (family member?) all mumbled something in Spanish and laughed. It was obvious that they all laughed on my feedback on a bad avocado. I wanted to support a small business so I came here instead of my favorite place "Crepevine" just two doors away. It was a TOTAL waste of money and felt cheated. No tip!
author: Chance M.

description:
This cute diner is located along Irving street. When I walked in, it reminded me of a cozy diner from a movie. It's a comfortable size with booth and table seating. My friend and I grabbed a table in the back as it wasn't too busy. 

The server quickly came to offer us coffee. We ordered pumpkin pancakes, which is a seasonal dish going on right now! And then we also ordered corned beef hash benedict. The pancakes were good, but there was nothing exceptional about it. The hash was also okay, but again, there's nothing that made it special. It came with a side of potatoes, which were not very good. I would go back if I was in the mood for another diner meal. 

But the service there was great. Our server was always kind to check in on my friend and I. Pricing is slightly expensive for the quality of food, but I suppose that's to be expected in San Francisco.
author: Jackie C.

description:
Came to Cafe Rain Tree for some brunch in the inner sunset because the original restaurant I was aiming for was closed. Cafe Rain Tree has a decent selection of items, ranging from typical breakfast dishes like omelettes and pancakes to other items such as crepes, sandwiches, and burgers. The service here is a bit slow, but staff members seem warm and friendly.

The cafe interior is worn-down, and from where I was sitting, I could see into the dish room, which didn't look very clean and tidy. It was no wonder that my plastic drinking cup was all dented and tattered. I ordered an omelette, which came with a side of toast and potatoes/fries. While the food didn't taste spectacular, the big portion really filled me up. Compared with the many other brunch spots in San Francisco, the overall quality of Cafe Rain Tree could be improved with some small tweaks, especially in the food safety and sanitation area.
author: Winnie Y.

description:
The only reason I am giving this 1 star is because it is the lowest possible rating that Yelp allows me to give. 

Since this is a breakfast spot, I would imagine that breakfast would be second nature to the people running the place. False, breakfast is a foreign language to these people. 

The waitress spilled coffee all over the table while topping off my already full cup and proceeded to apologize, but not wipe it up. 

Along with the customer service, the food was garbage. Based on the rubbery consistency of my poached eggs, they were definitely just microwaved. The hollandaise sauce also lacked flavor. Never in my life have I tasted hollandaise sauce that bland, and I've tried McDonald's version of eggs benedict (desperate times call for desperate measures). Home style fries were also a strange consistency that felt like play-doh in my mouth. 

Cheers.
author: Corinne L.

description: I used to work in the Inner Sunset and a colleague offered to buy me breakfast here. I happily accepted and just asked for a side of 2 eggs, 2 slices of bacon and toast. Simple breakfast staple how can you mess that up? The food came in a take out clear plastic container. The eggs had NO TASTE whatsoever. I had to flavor it with salt and pepper. The slices of bacons were an oily mess. Toast was hard. But what appalled me were the eggs! This cafe has been here for many years and breakfast is their speciality. How can you mess up your speciality and its EGGS! Thank goodness I didn't pay for this meal but it was still such a waste of money.
author: Annie L.

description:
Tasty diner food, and a warm welcome

Cafe rain tree is a hole in the wall diner for sure. Simple menu and greasy food. Upon entering I knew what I was in for so I am not surprised that the food was nothing spectacular. We had the irish breakfast (2 irish bacon, 2 irish sausagw, 2 eggs and homefries, black and white pudding) which we shared. It was sufficient and cooked to our liking. The coffee was pretty good, but not as strong as anticipated. Total cost : 18.49 plus tip.
It is an okay place.
author: Leanne R.

description: I personally love coming here. Lots lacking but I'm a simple girl when it comes to breakfast diners. It's got the basics, good coffee, and neighborhood diner feel. Friendly staff and good for people watching. If you want something that you could probably make at home but would rather go out, this is the spot.
author: Leah M.

description: I liked this place. Easy to get into, easy to order and what came out was very decent food. I got the Irish Breakfast and everything on it was cooked correctly and in a timely manner. The iced tea was good, not burnt or some kind of fruit tea. Service was quick. For a small neighborhood breakfast joint I couldn't have asked for much more.
author: James R.

description: Ordered the #1 French toast and also the farmers omelette. Pretty good brunch, should have went with an espresso beverage instead of drip coffee. Fast service and a pleasant spot overall.
author: Jody D.

description:
Although the place looks worn down, it's by far one of my favorite breakfast places in this area. 

I always get the Irish breakfast and it's always superb.
author: Catarina Z.

description:
Steak and eggs, served with home fried potatoes and sourdough toast. Also ordered a coffee.

Hygiene: Needs improvement. The chef went back and forth between handling dirty and clean dishes and cooking food. Did not observe hand-washing in between. Waitress went back and forth between handling money, taking orders and buttering the toast with bare hands. Also no hand-washing observed in between the different tasks.

Service: Attentive and friendly. Coffee was topped-up multiple times (never got to less than half-full before it got topped-up again). 

Cost: Including a 15-18% tip, came to $21.49.

Steak: Ordered medium, as suggested by the waitress. Was well, well, well-done. Very dry as it was also thin (I wonder if it had been cooked with one of those flat, heavy metal tools that were on the grill on top of it).

Eggs: Ordered over-easy. Perfectly prepared. Oozy yolk, solid whites.

Potatoes: Nice and crispy on the outside and cut small. Average portion size.

Toast: Lightly toasted. Served lukewarm and heavily buttered with salted butter.

Coffee: Average diner coffee. Bottomless cup.
author: I Like T.

description:
This is the most underrated restaurant in the neighborhood. The food is classic, done perfectly every time. The eggs Benedict is one of the best around and the French toast is nice and thick.

The wait staff is super friendly and attentive. The food comes out quick, it's cheap (or at least very reasonably priced), and there's never a long wait. 

I don't know why other reviews are so low, I guess you have one bad experience and it ruins a place for you. I keep going back to Rain Tree and have yet to have anything but a delightful experience.
author: Kimberlee A.

description: Super fresh Tuna Melt sandwich, the server was friendly and nice . And I would come back.
author: Simon B.

description: This place is really great for a solid classic breakfast. There is a large array from omelettes to choose from and they are all delicious!! Their pancakes and waffles are also really great! The waffle is soft on the inside but crisp on the outside. For the more adventurous breakfast eater they also have a traditional Irish breakfast which is delicious! My boyfriend always gets it every time we go. The service here is great and the owner is lovely. I would highly recommend this place.
author: Allison I.

description:
Well I least they fed me right?

I mean come here expecting little and maybe you won't be disappointed. But  don't come here expecting to be both nourished and satisfied, my dear you are barking up the wrong tree. 

What I liked: 
Not a huge wait we were able to get in fairly quickly. 
They do have a nice variety of food options. 
The english muffin was toasted well!

What I didn't like: 
The food was decent. Wasn't well seasoned and lacked a bit of charm. 
Chicken apple sausage was even flavorless. 

I got the Chicken Apple Sausage and 2 Eggs which was about $10. It just didn't seem worth the price in its basicness.

Service was decent I suppose.
author: Jenelle B.

description: Have no idea why this only has 2 1/2 stars. My friend and I have eaten here several times and it always satisfies our greasy spoon diner fix. Good food, clean, friendly service, and as a bonus, their orange juice is fresh squeezed! don't always avoid a place because of its yelp score. Try it out for yourself.
author: Colin B.

description: Less than average. Omelette was dry, flat, paper thin. Home fries tasteless. Best thing was the side of white toast. Disappointed.  Used to be acceptable. Not coming back.
author: Ben L.

description: This is a local diner that has been in business for a very long time... I have no idea how. The food was absolutely disgusting ...the crab cake Benedict was not edible. The pancakes were like rubber. And the service was garbage just like the food. I imagine the only customers they have are the ones that don't return. I have been to this place once before and remember it being garbage then too. 30 dollars for inedible food.
author: Mel M.

description: Awful food, rude staff.  I wish I can give zero stars for food which was probably prepared a week ago.
author: Arthur K.

description: Service was great! Food was even more delicious than it looked. And it was a great atmosphere for my friends to have brunch! I will definitely be coming back.
author: Nicholas L.

description: The food is a 4 and the prices are a 2. Two of us for brunch & one drink came to $35. If it was $25, it would be a 4.  The food, a BLT & savory Crape was good, & well presented. Not giant American size portions (a plus) which some places can not help themselves. Will come back for the long rotation. Shorter rotation for other places.
author: Leung T.

description: My boyfriend and I walked in, we were trying to find a nice quiet place to have a late brunch. Immediately we were asked if our dog was a service dog, which she is. We were then asked to provide proof that she was in fact a service dog. I've never been asked to provide proof of this. It is actually not a requirement to carry any sort of permit and it is actually illegal for someone to ask for such information as it is an invasion of privacy. I will never go back to this establishment and I do not recommend this place to anyone.
author: Nicole L.

description: Popped in here with my gf on a whim. Server was super sweet to us. Fresh squeezed oj is actually fresh squeezed! The food was solid diner food, which is what we were in the mood for. Nothing mind blowing, but quite tasty. Bloob pancakes were the highlight. Mmm.
author: Tessa T.

description: Cute tiny cafe/ diner. Has a lot of charm and the menu is good with all the classic breakfast / lunch items and soon good entrees but the soup I got was luke warm :( and the male waiter wasn't very nice or welcoming. You don't have to be a clown or hug us but a smile would be ok ?
author: Linda G.

description:
Very legit breakfast spot - many of the places in the area don't have a full traditional breakfast menu like these guys do.

Must order the oj - idk if it's fresh squeezed or what but it was pulpy & delicious. 

Got the two style eggs breakfast, hash browns with whole wheat toast which was solid and satisfying. 

Very small place, but fast service. From my experience they have "an eat it while it's hot style" serving, meaning they don't serve everyone at once - not my favorite but not a deal breaker.

Yummy
author: Kathleen D.

description:
January 6, 2014 Monday - breakfast 8:30 AM
3 adults

Atmosphere - 4 stars
Food - 4 stars
Service - 5 stars 

Background - We are on our way to the California Academy of Sciences from Daly City.   So the plan was to find the first area with some restaurants and we would park.  Well we ended up right in from of here. 

Atmosphere - An old diner that is a little worn down but lots of character.

Food
  Drinks - Coffee, but refills were hard to come by. 

  Appetizer - None.

  My Main Course - I had the banana pancakes.  I watched our cook pick the bananas and cut them up and place into the batter.  Everything was from scratch.  They were a filling warm breakfast.  I could even watch him cook them.  I enjoyed them and would get them again.

  Dessert - None after breakfast.

Service - For only two groups it was slow.

Future - Yes if I lived in the area but location and where I live makes it difficult.
author: Paul S.

description:
Been meaning to drop by this place for a while.. I actually enjoy a good diner experience, so I didn't have expectations beyond that.. 
That said, you could probably do better going to the Crepe place or Howard's around the block..
Nice enough, but the coffee was warm, not hot-- and everything was mediocre.  I had the Eggs Florentine with a side of sliced tomatoes.. just OK.
author: Kelly C.

description: After the Hot Chocolate 15K, got back to the car at SFSU and decided on brunch. Original destination was Inner Sunset CrepeVine, but after circling around a few times for parking, wandered into Cafe Rain Tree instead. They also had crepes and daily specials including pancakes and French Toast! Both of the other gals had hot tea and the Smoked Salmon Eggs Benedict (salmon in place of the ham), and I stuck with a coffee and the Sierra Omelette (ham, tomato, mushroom, cheese, green onion) which comes with house potatoes and toast (two full slices cut in half, but still huge!). Cute little hole-in-the-wall place, can get full/busy but we were seated right away. I realize that my particular order wasn't anything extraordinary, but they did a solid job with an unassuming omelette and all ingredients tasted fresh. Decent coffee too hit the spot. Had the odd bell pepper piece mixed in with the potatoes but no biggie. Ketchup bottle is glass, not the squeeze kind, be aware of mess-making risks. So many other eateries in the vicinity that I highly doubt I'll be back, but it was a good meal before leaving the city.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Pros:
* service is extremely expedient and friendly
* location

Con:
* food is standard American diner fare
author: Anthony B.

description: My friends and I came here for brunch on New Year's Day when we were starving and I was craving eggs. It is a total dive-y diner, but actually got the job done for what we needed it to do. I ordered the Mediterranean scramble and it came with a lot of artichokes, olives and feta, which was exactly what I wanted. The potatoes that it came with were cold, unfortunately. The service could have been quicker. We had to ask for coffee refills multiple times and it took awhile for our food to come out. If we had more time to find a place, this probably wouldn't have been the one!
author: Jana B.

description: We came here on a raining day on Saturday so there wasn't any wait. Usually it's packed. The French toasts were cooked perfectly- I don't like the wet bread within the toasts so the chef made them the way I like. The service was very good too. Many refills on coffee without needing me ask.
author: Annie N.

description:
Sadly, Cafe Rain Tree's 2.5-star rating (at the time of this review) is right on the money.

The food was pretty unspectacular. Everything we ordered was quite bland. Two items worth calling out (not in a good way) were the orange juice and the bacon. The orange juice was on the extreme end of pulpy, and they questionably added crushed ice to the OJ. That doesn't make for a pleasant, refreshing morning beverage, at least in my opinion. The side of bacon I ordered was room temperature (I think it was precooked and sitting out) and overcooked.

The service was attentive and fast, but not particularly pleasant. It might be nit-picky to expect a smile with your eggs, but it could've made the difference here between a 3-star and 2-star review.

Cafe Rain Tree could really crush it with its stellar location. Hopefully they're reading and acting on these reviews, which strike similar notes, to realize their potential.
author: Matt T.

description: Was in the neighborhood decided to eat breakfast here.  Very disappointed in the quality of food.  French toast, sausages, pancakes awful!  Even coffee was bad. Spoiled creamer was old.  Nothing taste fresh!  Not very tasty gave me a stomach ache.  Will not return.
author: Michele L.

description: Love it, the family really likes this place. Cheap prices, very friendly staff and most of all great food
author: J W.

description:
This week I tried all 3 hole in the wall breakfast places around 9th and Irving.

Cafe Rain Tree is definitely the one to avoid at all costs, 0 stars if possible.

I ate here about 10 years ago, thought it awful, but figured hey, it's been awhile, let me try it again. Big mistake. Both the service and the food was beyond pathetic. I dined alone and sat at the counter, the only person. The menu arrived soon enough, and I put it down in an obvious "I'm ready to order" while making eye contact with the waitress. She proceeded to make 2 milkshakes while completely ignoring my simple order (Eggs Benedict and a coffee), and then took the order of a party that had arrived and sat at a table way after I sat down. Then she seated another party at the counter before addressing me.

I ordered the EB soft-poached and promptly got my coffee, she asked whether I wanted cream. I said yes, so she got the little metal jug and put it on the counter, maybe filled or didn't fill it, but that's the last I saw of it because it went to another table and my request for cream was never addressed again. The EB arrived and the eggs were hard as rocks, the home potatoes wilted and soft. I cut the eggs in half, tasted a potato, and got up to leave.

I said to the waitress, "This is horrendous, the eggs are rock hard when I ordered them soft, I'm leaving, I'm outta here, let's just call it even". And I left, definitely never coming back now.

Fool me once, shame on you, fool me twice...
author: Rob C.

description:
Pretty Blah, There are a lot of choices on the menu but for the most part everything I tried was tasteless and drab, lacked seasoning also the bacon seemed  like it had been sitting out for while before being served. The eggs were OK and the OJ was actually very good, npt fresh but good.
The prices seemed just too high for the quality of the food and the service. I don't think we will go back.
author: Christopher E.

description:
I was with some friends from LA on Saturday and we were looking for somewhere to eat. We came here after being neglected at another place. Their prices are reasonable. I ended up getting the Banana Pancake Special (2 pieces of bacon and eggs) for about $8. It didn't take long for us to get our food. Everything was good except the pancakes. The pancakes were the perfect consistency, but they tasted sour! I don't know if it was because of the bananas or the milk, but it didn't not taste good. And the waitress never came back to see how we were doing.

I won't be coming back!
author: Vanessa S.

description: Poor service; did not feel welcome.  Did not stay.  Went to Lale instead -- see review -- great experience!
author: K H.

description: The food was totally awful. Burnt poor quality bacon, burnt potatoes, over cooked eggs. The toast was okay. Disgusting sugary marmalade on the table. Would not recommend.
author: Anastasia J.

description:
"Yo, Gordon Ramsey gots to put this place in check!" - wise words from bf. Here's the scenario, bf and I been having brunch at Crepevine a lot lately...so we wanted to try something different. Just a few shops down is Rain Tree. Thought we'd give it a go. 

Upon entering RTC, it's just a typical small greasy spoon diner. No frills, but we're thinking maybe a good hole in the wall. They have the chef cooking at the open kitchen right behind the counter. Only a few tables were occupied and two people sat at the counter. The lady who seemed like the manager said we could sit anywhere. 

Brunch specials for $9.50.... sounded good. I chose the Portabella Benedict and bf chose the Bacon Avo Omelette. After we ordered, we decided to check out the reviews on yelp. Oh damn.... 2.5 stars. Too bad we didn't check beforehand. We were sitting there, hoping that we'd have a decent bfast. 

One thing I noticed was that the manager and waitress were helping make the toast. However, both these ladies were touching money, menus and serving the dishes in between while handling the toast with their bare hands. I did not see either of these women wash their hands once. Violation health code right there. I understand that there's only one cook, so they're trying to help out but please do not touch my toast with the same hands you just used to handle money. Did you know that money is filthy and that fecal matter can be found on it? I read that in TIME magazine. Ick ick ick! 

When our food arrived, bf and I were like.....WTF. It looked like someone had just threw everyone on the plates. Not asking for high presentation points there but damn, I can make something more appetizing in my own kitchen. 

Right away, I noticed that the poached eggs on my benedict were still raw. The egg whites were clear! I told the waitress. She apologized, said they'd make me a new one and took it back to the chef. A few minutes later, she brings my food again. Guess what? I know for a fact that they just stuck it in the microwave and did not make a new one. The ketchup I had put on my potatoes was still there. Seriously? I was so turned off....then I tasted the holindaise sauce which was just disgusting. It tasted very lemony. The portabella mushroom was very chewy esp since they microwaved it and the english muffin was now mushy. The potatoes were all falling apart and bland. 

The bacon avocado omelet was completely overcooked and burned. There was hardly any bacon or avo! We also found a moldy potato on bf's dish. The toast was bleh and we knew it was no good to begin with. 

Another quote from bf about this meal - "If I was on an deserted island and someone gave me this ish, I'd eat it." Horrible bfast! It wasn't cheap either...especially for a poor meal. Regret not having checked out the other yelp reviews before eating here. Always trust your fellow yelpers for good advice!
author: Liv A.

description: Coffee was weak. Potatoes lacked flavor. Price for a breakfast was high. Disappointed.
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
I just had brunch at this place today. I have been here in the past and just came from a long walk with my friends father so we were exhausted. walked in and sat in the first table by window with 2 table settings. so everyone knows, I am Filipino and my father's friend is Chinese.  a few moments later, a Latina server came over and asked us how many was in our party and I replied just the 2 of us. she then told me that the table is intended for more than 2. I obliged then she guided us to the very back table of the place. I then noticed that all other tables along the wall sat 2 persons each although they are for 4people. they all say Caucasian patrons. I decided to sit down at the bar stool instead. I then mentioned to her what was the problem of us sitting by the window. she just said
 that that seat is intended for families. and I questioned did she also mention this to all the customers sitting behind me that so happened to sit in better situated tables rather than the one all the way in the back. her response was this "Let me explain to you"... she said this while she was gesturing her pointing finger towards me.

annoyed by the response I told her I didn't wanna hear it. another lady assisted me (she's Caucasian) and asked if I questions about the seating. she was nice about it. she's soft spoken so that calmed me down a bit. I told her my concern and asked was there something special about us? she said no and she apologized and said that depending on the time of day they save the window seat for a bigger party. I then mentioned the 2 table setting that was there and still there and that it was misleading. other restaurants I have gone to either place signs by the door to either wait to be seated or just seat yourself. this place have neither. and when we initially walked in nobody was immediately there to great us until several minutes after sitting down. so this last then said that unfortunately people don't pay attention to signs and would just sit anyways. 
now, I have always been a hot-headed person and would now always think of my friend about my actions. I decided to calm down and just accepted what I was told. I also told this lady that at least they should place a 4table setting instead of 2 and she did that after i placed our order. 
    I don't know if I was white would this have happened to me? I know that most San Franciscans are very aware of wait times or signs at restaurants. it's just our restaurant culture here. we expect wait times. 

to the owners, please create a sign so that people of color that visit your establishment do not mistake this as racism.
author: Carol C.

description:
Bland. I got the Hawaiian crepe, but if I were not told it was a crepe, I wouldn't even know. Crepes should be thin, but if anything, my crepe resembled more of a calzone. The house potatoes were also dry. 

The service was amicable the day I went, but the blandness keeps me from coming back. Perhaps a non-crepe would be a better option.
author: Brittany L.

description: The food here is delicous! The hot chocolate is nothing special, but the food and service was a plus.
author: Cat E.

description:
ONE SLICE OF MEAT IN MY SANDWICH (I'm not joking)

I only went to this restaurant once.  I ordered a turkey breast sandwich. The sandwich had ONE slice of turkey breast in it.  I couldn't believe my eyes.  I never went back to this restaurant ever again.  Every time I pass by this place I think about the sandwich with the one slice of meat.  Thank you, Cafe Rain Tree.
author: Rudy G.

description: Coffee was weak, home fries were cold and bland.  Bacon and avacado omelet was tasty.
author: Greg W.

description:
I stumbled upon this place by accident, and I'm glad I did..... It was fairly busy but found a counter seat, and got to watch the cook do his thing up close..... Man can that guy get down or what.... I didn't catch his name, but I'm making it a point to look for him becauase he's great.
I am very particular when it comes to egg's, and only want to see white & yellow (no burned edge, clear under cooked liquid) and this guy WAS PERFECT.....! I had the corned beef hash, and it was great, with toast, potatoes, and a smiling waitress.... I will defiantly be back, and its worth the drive from Diamond Heights... I noticed this place is also in West Portal, so I will be so inclined to check that place out also, GOOD TIMES!
author: John G.

description: Always seated quickly here. The staff is friendly and attentive. Their breakfast is good, not spectacular. It's what I would expect from a greasy spoon type place. I've been there a number of times and never leave hungry :)
author: Alicia E.

description: Just a normal breakfast place - old fashioned. Nice homey service and an option to sit at the bar. Nothing trendy. My omelet was so-so and I always appreciate when they sub potatoes for salad.
author: Andrew K.

description:
How is this place still open? My boyfriend and I live close and were coming from church super hungry so we went here just to try it. 

It starts off with terrible service when the waitress neither greets or gives us any direction to being seated, so my boyfriend and I are standing there for an awkward eternity it seems before we are even acknowledged. Red flag #1. I later see that there's a small handwritten sign that says "seat yourself where table is clean." We sat ourselves at the bar and notice a number of tables that were empty, but haven't been waited yet. Red flag #2. My boyfriend and I sit down to review the menu and when we've made our decisions, we put down our menu to get the waitress' attention. Nope. The entire restaurant itself is small, so the fact that she didn't notice us waiting for a solid 10min is beyond me (Red flag #3) But my boyfriend and I aren't exactly in a rush so we aren't angry or anything. She finally takes our order and I ask for the porkchop, sunny side up eggs, and salad to replace the side of potatoes. My boyfriend orders the vegetarian dish American omelette but requests to add turkey. After we place our order, we wait. My boyfriend and I are sitting right in front of the cook so we are able to observe how he cooks. Red flag #4? My boyfriend sees him taking my porkchop, completely frozen, and pops it into the microwave to defrost. Yeah... My expectations are already lowering. We see him making other people's food meanwhile, and amongst many things wrong, we notice a pretty burnt pancake going out, him wiping one of the plates (with food already on it) with a dirty towel, the waitress taking people's orders incorrectly and wasting food as it was sent back, and overall, no care when it comes to the food that is being plated. When our food came out, as expected my porkchop was 100% dry on top of being the flattest and tiniest portion ever. I took a few bites and literally spat it out (as undramatically as possible) because it was like eating salty rubber. The cook forgot to replace my potatoes with a salad and had to switch it out after being reminded of my order (which he did so by using his hands to push it off my plate and back into the pile of potatoes used for all plates). However, I did get to try those potatoes via my boyfriend's dish and needless to say, we didn't finish that either. There was like a hint of cayenne pepper that seasoned it very poorly. And it was cooked very mashed and dry. Given I'm a home cook myself, I was not impressed. My boyfriend's omelette was actually decent, but even he said there's no way you can mess up an omelette, and he doesn't cook... At all. I had earlier ordered waters when the waitress originally took my order, but never got it so I asked for waters when I luckily got her attention. She comes back with ONE water. SERIOUSLY? So I proceed to ask her for another for my boyfriend. Overall, we finally got our check and couldn't wait to leave.

I honestly don't understand why people would open a restaurant and not strive to make it at least decent. Everything was just not good here and I rarely complain. So here it is.
author: Quynh M.

description:
The french toast was dry and the breakfast sausage fatty.  Eggs over easy were perfect.   My friend enjoyed the pancakes.

The waiter was very friendly and efficient.

It smelled of mold inside the restaurant.
author: Debbie T.

description:
Went here for lunch with a friend.... I ordered a tuna salad sandwich and my friend ordered an avocado BLT.  I had maybe two tablespoons of tuna in my sandwich.  My friend had a smear of avocado in his sandwich (not even a slice of avocado).  Ripped off as their prices are high.
Be aware....the cashier/waitress DOES NOT practice good hand hygiene.  We were there for at least 45 minutes sitting at the counter and we watched her handle the cash register/exchange cash with customers and also help prepare the sandwiches (putting slices of bread in the toaster).  She did not use gloves  when handling the food and NEVER washed her hands at the sink. GROSS!!! Hello Health Dept.!!!!!!
author: Jean Y.

description: Hawaiian crepe was really good (I asked for no onions), but beer was served in a warm glass making it borderline awful to drink, and 85% of my potatoes were burnt and cold. Meal was definitely not worth the 20 dollars I spent on it.
author: Tatum H.

description:
I don't get the low score for this place. It's a typical family diner, serving up a hearty breakfast with a, excuse me, a damn fine cup of coffee. 

The service is a bit on the slow side when it's busy, but that's kinda what a place being busy implies. But, like any sort of diner, this is not where you should go when you're in a rush. It's where to go when you want to sit down and getting a filling breakfast-and the aforementioned damn fine cup of coffee.
author: Steve A.

description: Incompetent waitress!!! Gave us the wrong order with no accountability!! Expected us to wait for them to correct their mistake...
author: Alexei L.

description:
I haven't written a bad review yet, but I would like to warn other people about this place.  Our waitress was rude and didn't even welcome us when she came to our table.  She was very hostile and short with us when she took our orders.

Everyone's food was delivered at different times on top of it taking forever despite the fact that there was hardly any other customers in the diner.  Additionally the food was low quality and came out cold.  It's cheap but this place has terrible service and not worth your time or money.
author: Jessica L.

description:
My friend and I ate here on a Monday morning around 11, which may be why our experience was the opposite of other yelpers. We were craving your basic breakfast fare, and this is what we got at Rain Tree. Service was quick and friendly, food was tasty, ambience exactly what we were looking for-- a cozy diner on a chilly autumn morning.

I ordered the Rain Tree special-- blueberry pancakes, 2 pieces of bacon, and two eggs-- yum! Can't screw that up. My friend ordered a cheese omelet which came with potatoes and toast. His exact words were, "Super good."
author: Kellyn A.

description: Solid neighborhood place with dandy options for eating lunch and diner. The environment is pretty mellow during the week days and the food is square. The service is good.
author: Tommy W.

description:
Pre-golf nourishment

or

Pirogi stratification

So, for a good brunch with extra padding with the eggs, Irish bacon and a stack of starchy cellulite promises in the form of pancakes, the perfect place.  Get in 18 holes and light the way to offset the 1000 calorie breakfast.

Today was none the wiser.  After walking a bit in the light shower to check out the Polish festival, the $5 bit for five of the smallest (but good, mind you) boiled pirogi seen to man, I was starving for meat.  No starch.  Strictly meat to offset the dumplings filled with pureed potatoes, now settling pleasantly at the base of my stomach.  Walked to Irving because we were nearby and choices choices choices up the ying yang.

Corner nook with a diner counter in the middle.  Plain menu here, which makes for easy perusing and winding down choices from either breakfast or lunch.  It was either the Eggs Blackstone or the Royal Burger and my meat driven cravings drove me to choose the burger, medium rare.  For $8.25, my burger patty was larger than the bun itself and hung over the edges.  A good two slices of tomatoes, one large romaine leaf bent in half, Irish bacon, cheese, one sunny side egg and my usual side of mayo.  This burger was so large, I could not even finish it.  The fries were so so, given the fact that I got shafted by all the short ends (come on, sheesh.  No one wants something short and stubby, wtf)  Otherwise, good french fries and slightly long enough to dip into the spilt yolk from the burger.  Yummy.

The fellow ordered the CA burger and other than just peering over for a second at his, I did notice that they arranged several slices of avocado on his patty, rather than the cheap ass smear I received at Bistro Burger the other day.  And he finished it off, which means it was tasty and all good.

Good food, decent prices and don't expect more than average customer service.  The majority of the people here they service are students anyways and that is all the better for average people such as ourselves, since we were looking for something simple and filling.  This is such a place.

Now to go hit some range balls so that I can burn off the tip of the calories donated by nibbling away at an Old Fashioned loaf from the Golden Donut.  

*sigh*
author: Miika M.

description:
I have no idea why people dislike this place. I would argue that it may the best breakfast place in Inner Sunset. 

I typically get an omelette (best in the area) with spinach, feta cheese, bacon, and tomato. Never upset. The home fries are delicious. 

Irving St cafe is just terrible, Howard's can be bland, Pasion and Park Chow are, well, Pasion an Park Chow, so try this out. 

Good coffee and quick service.
author: Jonathan B.

description: Great little breakfast spot. Friendly staff, and good food. Try the portobello benedict.
author: Míchael W.

description:
I'm not a SF native, so maybe my tastes aren't as fine as some of the other reviewers here but I was pleasantly satisfied with my Bacon, Egg, and Homefry brunch here at Cafe Rain Tree.

First off, folks are calling this a "greasy spoon". I'd like to announce that, that's probably the only reason for the knocked off star-- not enough butter.  I was looking for the oil in my over easy eggs and home fries but found almost none.  It was surprisingly clean and I'm sure my caloric intake thanked me for it.

The ladies were a little cold, but I wouldn't really say that... They just weren't chatty.  I didn't find this a negative.  They were attentive, checked and refilled my coffee without me needing to ask, and quickly got my food to me and others.  I'm not the sort of person who needs the extra attention, no special orders, so the service was on par.

This place had real bacon, real potatoes, and real preserves for my toast... That alone puts it leagues ahead of a dozen diners I've frequented this year.  They have to be doing something right when even the small 90 lb hipster girls next to me cleaned there plates.  In fact... Everyone cleaned their plates.  Complain all you want about cleanliness (which, really, if its cleaner than my house I really don't care) but the taste and value was fantastic.
author: Ashley C.

description:
We live in the neighborhood and on a rainy Saturday morning we decided to give Cafe Rain Tree a try because Art's had a line out the door.

Ugh. We decided to try it because most of the reviews were focused around service and we can get over that. The service is pretty lame, but whatever...

The food: mediocre at best. I had the BLTA which was OK, the fries weren't great and he had the Cali omelette. No seasoning on the potatoes and I just felt sick after. 

Bottom line: next time Art's is rockin the line we'll opt for that new huge La Boulange that just opened up!
author: Francesca F.

description: Mehh... small space tightly seated against the backs of others. Slow and inattentive service (water and coffee was served to other customers/groups who entered after us). Food priced at $9 or more and very basic. I've gotten their pancake and egg breakfast which comes as expected but small portions. Their monte cristo sandwich was unsatisfying and had ham that was kinda chewy and gritty. The only things I see going for this place is the window seating and the fact that they take card. Your time, money, and palate is better appreciated elsewhere on the many other breakfast places nearby.
author: Andrew T.

description:
First of all, don't go to this joint. Monday 6:50AM, other 2 local hole-in-wall cafés are closed so waited for this one til 7, and walked over. Sign in front says opens 7AM. Door is open. I start to walk in at 7:00 and am stopped by guy inside, told they aren't open yet. I mill around outside, reading paper. 7:10 they open. I get coffee, nothing special, kinda weak, but seems like coffee. Pick a California omelet with potatoes, which I asked for crispy, on side. Omelet not great, tiniest dab sour cream, but it sems OK. Potatoes not particularly well done, seem like they were frozen, not much flavor, kinda oily. 

Part way through my potatoes I notice a long black hair mixed in with them, look for combo cook/waiter, who in awhile comes in from vack, get his attention, point it out, no apology, says he'll cook me some hash browns. I say OK. He takes my plate. I immediately hear him scraping the potatoes off my plate into trash can, could not have had time to first remove my eggs sanitarily to new plate, and I am hoping he isn't bumping my plate with my omelet onto trash can rim. He brings what's left of my omelet back on new plate. Eventually brings a small plate with the barely-cooked hash browns, forgetting I asked for crispy, and this time bringing them even less cooked. I should be grateful: at least they weren't still frozen. 

During all of this, cold coffee was never offered to be refilled. No discount or apology for the hair. I left 85% of the hash browns on the plate. Paid with a 20 to the waitress who by then had arrived. She brought my $6-something change in all ones, fishing for a tip. No way. What a rip-off, and my stomach now is queasy from the oily undercooked flavorless potatoes, with my purse much lighter than it should be for that. Never going back there. Crappy way to start a day of hard work. Thanks a lot, on several counts...Not.
author: Nerdette C.

description: I like to go here because of the location and the food is just good decent dinner. Nothing over the top and it gets the job done. Unfortunately the service here is horrible. The girls that work here never smile, never say good morning, and seam to hate working here. It's really a shame because it's a cute place just don't expect any service here.
author: Johnny L.

description: This is a solid option for a diner type breakfast. The service was pretty fast and there was no wait on a Sunday at 11. I realize for most people no wait might seem like a bad sign, but I hate waiting for breakfast so I was willing to take a risk. I'm glad we tried it. The breakfast staples (eggs, bacon, etc) were all good and the service was decent. I wouldn't make a special trip to come here but I'll be back if I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Diana G.

description: Dope spot to grab some breakfast. Made ne feel like i was back at home. The cook is pretty dam skilled to get so many orders out the way by himself. Fsher coming back here when i come back to SF.
author: Samuel F.

description:
I thought my breakfast was pretty average.

I went in on a Sunday morning before 8 AM, and there was only one other diner at the time.  Seat yourself as the waitress suggested.  I took a seat, she brought me a menu and asked me what I wanted to drink.

She was back with my juice and to take my order as soon I put down the menu.  While the service was impeccable, the food itself lacked taste.

It was one of those season your own food-type experiences where everything lacked seasoning and just tasted bland.  I ordered a mushroom omelet (pictured) which came with home fries and choice of toast or an English muffin.

The portion was pretty big.  Despite the fact that it was loaded with mushrooms the omelet just tasted like eggs and grease. On these mornings I'm thankful for ketchup and hot sauce.  The home fries were soft potato cubes fried up brown and crispy with a bit of green onion, but it definitely needed the salt and pepper shakers and I'm not one to eat heavily salted foods.  The toast had just a light smear of butter which did nothing to keep it from being just dried pieces of toast.

I certainly filled up, but I think I'll try another breakfast spot should I be in the neighborhood next time.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: The name doesn't exactly appeal to me for breakfast, but it was the next best option when Irving Street cafe was closed.  So, I ventured with a friend for some corned beef hash with eggs over easy and rye toast.  The OJ was sweet and refreshing.  Overall, it was solid with smaller breakfast portions.  Nothing stood out of the ordinary except that this place was practically empty.  Having read some of the reviews, I'm not sure if I'd come back unless I was in a bind on a rainy day.
author: Jenny L.

description:
I should've read the reviews of this place before coming to eat here because if I had I definitely would have chosen another place to avoid the drama of this place. 

My boyfriend wanted to take me to breakfast and since I live nearby and haven't really tried any of the restaurants we decided to try someplace new. First entering the restaurant we were greeted by a girl and my first impression of her was "Wow, she looks miserable" because of her lack of any type of emotion in her greet. We seated ourselves at the only open table in the back by the sinks where they washed the dishes (I had no problem with this except during our whole meal there was a lingering smell of bleach which began to bother me towards the end). On the table there was only one menu so we had to share because no one ever came to give us another one. We ordered our food; one French toast special and one pancake special. When it arrived everything seemed fine but towards the end of the meal my boyfriend stops to tell me he has found a hair in his French toast. We literally have to wait about 10 minutes to get the miserable waitress attention because she spent a majority of her time towards the front of the restaurant. When she finally came to our table and my boyfriend told her about the hair she seemed to look offended and replied with "do you want me to take it away?". My boyfriend said yes and the waitress took his plate then walked away not even having the decency to apologize for the inconvenience. She comes back 10 minutes later with our check... This is the part that shocks me the most... She had the nerve to say "I gave you a discount on your meal" then walks away.... She took $1 off of our meal. Excuse my language, but this bitch is trippin. My boyfriend and I sat there really stuck like wow is she serious? Most places I've been to will give you the meal for free or at least offer you something else as a replacement. But she didn't do any of that. We have to wait ANOTHER 10 minutes to have her come back to ask her if we could have a order of French toast for free because my boyfriend wasn't even able to finish his first order. She huffs and puffs then said she has to ask her manager. When she returns she said that they said her manager said it was ok. We get the French toast, pay, then get the hell out of there. 

I hate having to write this review but the service here was TERRIBLE. They need to have a serious talk with their sorry ass excuse of a waitress because this experience was ridiculous.
author: Andreena J.

description:
You guys, I've found it. The worst restaurant in San Francisco. Not the sort of thing I was actively seeking out, but definitely a "you know it when you see it" situation. 

The eggs were rubber, the bacon was leather, and the food was somehow both overcooked and cold at the same time. I just... I will never go back and will encourage everyone to stay the hell away.

To be fair, the service lovely, but nothing could make up for food that terribly prepared. Sorry.
author: Miguel V.

description:
OMG.  Sat down for lunch and the floor was completely littered with breakfast crap.  Not just a couple of crumbs - I mean filthy.  I joke to the waitress "your carpet sweeper must have broken"  Instead of taking time to clean up, she said "I don't have time to do everything"  If you don't have time to make your establishment look presentably, do you and the cook have time to get my order out in a timely fashion.  I don't think so!  Almost gave her a pass, and then decided to walk.  This place is overpriced and being operated on a shoestring.  Avoid, avoid, avoid.

To management - get more help!
author: Douglas B.

description:
I would love to be able to give you all a very detailed account of my experiences, but unfortunately (or fortunately after reading some of these reviews) I was never given the opportunity to try this place out.

I saw their breakfast specials in the window and thought "Oh, great price! I could go for some pancakes". But as I went to open the door the waitress inside gave me the time out signal. Wait, what was that? Confused, I checked the closing times. Strange, it says it's open to 4pm but it was only 2:40pm. I left to go look around in Tutti Frutti figuring that maybe she was on a lunch break. When I came back the waitress (who was previously drinking coffee) was now on the phone. 

Okkaaaay...... Maybe they closed early? Really, really early? The woman didn't seem open to receiving customers so I just walked over to Crepevine and got a dessert crepe that was probably much better than anything I would have gotten here.
author: G C.

description: I have no problem with this place. It's not huge, but service is quick, and the portions are pretty massive. It's your general greasy spoon that uses a few more fresh ingredients to make omelettes and such. I like how the menu isn't ridiculously complicated and that the dishes aren't super meat-centric. The California omelette I had with spinach, tomatoes, cheese, and avocado was a little light on the avocado and tomato, but it wasn't super greasy like omelettes are, and the home fries that came with them were crispy and light (also not super greasy, so just to my liking).
author: Danny C.

description: Terrible service! When we first walked in the waiter was friendly but when it came to actually serving us he had no idea what he was doing. I asked for a side of avocado when I ordered my veggie burger when it was served to me I asked for it again. I got tired of waiting, at this point my veggie burger is cold so I just eat it. The waiter comes over with our bill then realizes he never brought it. He literally says to me "I put your avocado over there" as he points behind the counter. Lol like was I suppose to go behind the counter and get it?!? That wasn't even the half of the shitty service my friends and I got here. On top of that food is not great no flavor and dry. Will not ever come back.
author: Chae K.

description: It was okay. Turkey was from a roll, my friends bacon was burnt to a crisp and there was only one soup available today. The cafe itself is nice though. Wish I had ordered something else. And they wouldn't split the bill which sucked.
author: Krissy O.

description: It was AMAZING!!!!!! From the salad to the French toast. I totally recommend this place.  If you go there, I recommend getting the French toast.
author: julien b.

description:
The service here is quick and efficient, then again...I'd expect nothing less since it's pretty much a ghost town. The menu features the breakfast basics, some sandwiches, and crepes. They also have specials not listed on the menu - they are listed on a tiny card on your table. 

Mom and I ordered two different breakfast combinations. The french toast was nice and thick, not soggy, but rather bland. Other than that, the sausage was your average breakfast sausage - horribly salty and the eggs were...meh. The pancakes, on the other hand, were buttery and fluffy. But I've never seen dryer bacon...it probably would have disintegrated to powder if I tried to stab it. 

Together, our bill came out to under $10 which is a steal for a breakfast, but considering the quality was no greater than a complementary continental holiday inn breakfast, maybe we still lost.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Pretty good for your neighborhood greasy spoon. 

They do have waffle crack here which is pretty amazing I have to say. WAFFLE CRACK. YOU MUST HAVE SOME.

No frills food served with a good attitude. Sometimes its a little slow, other times it is super fast.
author: Katie D.

description:
Pretty much your basic American diner and nothing else. They served breakfast all day which is awesome and more likely to cater to the vegetarian crowd. But if I hadn't ordered pancakes, I would have had a hard time finding something to eat. 
My boyfriend and I went on a Sunday around 1 PM, and it wasn't crowded at all. They had a total of four people working there with the entire prep line and grill in the front of house and they kept the door closed which was slowly suffocating me to death. The waitress and server were really attentive though. 
I got the cafe breakfast special: two blueberry pancakes, two eggs, and sausage (that I substituted for toast). I asked for sourdough and they brought me barely toasted and slightly stale white bread.. But whatevs. My boyfriend got the bacon cheeseburger with onion rings, which he said tasted relative to it's price. The both of our plates came to just about $20.
author: Emma G.

description:
Just the facts on my experience related to Cafe Rain Tree. 

I lived local and decided to try it out. I went one morning feeling fine and on an empty stomach. Had eggs with bacon, toast with butter and coffee. Nothing else to eat afterwards that day and started getting violently ill in the early afternoon, which lasted until into the evening - so sick I almost headed to the ER.

I have never been back.
author: Jon M.

description:
Everything about this place is bland.

The food, the waitress, the space itself, is all sort of dreary.

2 stars for "good-enough" diner food.
author: Jennifer A.

description:
Based on many of these reviews here, I would have thought that Cafe Rain Tree was guilty of some kind of Capital Offense (or puppy-kicking at the least). Luckily, I don't pay attention to much of anything that anyone else says (heck, I don't even listen to the other 52 voices in my head... usually).

Well, I threw caution to the wind (and, of course, it came back and hit me square in the face ~ it was one of those blustery San Francisco mornings) and ate there on Saturday anyway. 

I had the California Omelette ~ with tomato, avocado, spinach, & Jack cheese; served with home fried potatoes and toast or English muffin. It was neither criminally offensive (but I did feel it necessary to kick a puppy in Golden Gate Park on my way back to my car) nor anything to write yelp* about (but that is already too late). It was a good enough breakfast and if I ever found myself in the neighborhood again and was hungry (and Art's Cafe, Crepevine, and Irving Street Cafe weren't open yet or too crowded), I would eat there again.

If you would care to read a more detailed take on my breakfastary review (and other idiocy), click on my profile here and check out my stupid li'l 'blog thingy.
author: Brian M.

description:
Just walk away from this place.  right now. walk away. there are better options just around the corner.


This is my first bad review after many, many years being on Yelp. I hate doing this, but this place just ruined my day. 
The husband took a break from work and decided to take me out to breakfast on this beautiful sunny October morning in the Inner Sunset. Our destination was actually Park Chow (we love you, Park Chow), but they had already stopped serving breakfast, so we decided to try another nearby place... and then we made the mistake of walking into this place. To start the girl who was behind the counter looked like she clearly didn't want to be there, which okay, I don't blame her. Then the knife that was placed in front of me to use was dirty. Okay, I didn't complain because I hate being that kind of person, so I just reached for the seating next to me and grabbed other knife. Then my food comes and there was a freaking long, blond HAIR in it. I tell the girl about it ( I'm sorry I had to disturb you from playing with your phone, lady, but there is a hair in my food!) and she doesn't even apologize, or anything, just takes my plate away and doesn't even ask me if I'd like to order it again or if I'd like something else, she just takes it away with a annoyed expression. Not even the slightest apology. Okay, girl, maybe it's not your fault that YOUR blonde hair was in my plate, but neither is mine. You could at least had been nicer about it. It's called good costumer service. After an  awkward while without even saying a word she brings me another plate ... WITHOUT ever asking me if I want it. I take the food... and because I don't want to be a bitch and say that i don't want it, because I lost my appetite, I just take some hesitant bites, try to eat the eggs and the english muffin, but then I just give up (the food was terrible by the way). Then she brings the bill and that's when my husband gets upset . After all that terrible experience she charges the full price for my food? REALLY?  I would have gladly and quietly payed the bill, walked away and never go back, but my husband worked in the food industry for many years and he HATES bad customer service. And when he complains about it, the cook comes out and tells us that we are trying to eat for free and that he's seen that before. REALLY? REALLY? 

Thanks for ruining my morning, Cafe Rain Tree. I am always surprised that in a city like San Francisco, with so many amazing options for food, a place like this is still open. Your food is just bad, but the customer service really was the worst I've ever experienced. I will never ever walk into this place again.
author: Juliana A.

description: Food is slow and service is terrible!  I asked for two glasses of water.  The waitress stared at me angrily and said"anything else?"
author: Jian M.

description: Nothing here is really exceptional, but I still find myself coming here on a fairly regular basis.  Good simple diner food in a comfortable diner setting, served by nice folks.  The irish breakfast is a great hearty way to start a long weekend day (or recover from a long weekend night).  It's also one of the only options in the area if you want breakfast food for dinner, and we all know how awesome the occasional brinner can be.
author: Joshua W.

description: Awesome for what it is! I ordered eggs, potatoes and toast. They were super friendly and fast. I love watching them put plates together. I'd appreciate cleaner utensils but I enjoyed my breakfast after a long night shift. Check out the small statue chugging Charles shaw- it's great.
author: hannah l.

description:
Definitely do not go here!

Food and service were both very bad.

Food came at very different times. The potatoes were cold and my friends burger was cold. Our server acted like she really didn't want to be there and kept forgetting to bring us our drinks and sides.
author: Lydia L.

description:
The potatoes served on the side of dish were the worst i ever experienced! Absolute no salt , burnt and bland! Same with the salmon scramble, with just big chunks of salmon and no other taste, except for the dallop of sour cream! 

The only good side had consistently been the blueberry pancakes. Wont come back again and waste my time and money here when there are so many other small breakfast nooks with the same low prices around.
author: Payal B.

description:
Had  breakfast here many days in a row during a business trip last year, and it never disappointed. 

The prices are right, the service was prompt, and the taste is spot on. That is all I was looking for when I came in, and I was not disappointed.
author: Sam H.

description:
Good not great. This happened to be one of the only spots without a line on a rainy Sunday, so we figured why not? They also had a good looking special on their white board in the window- Portobello Eggs Benedict. Well I am a sucker for Portobello Mushrooms, and I love Eggs Benedict so of course I had to order that. It was pretty good with large slabs of mushrooms, however very much under seasoned. The mushroom itself could have been grilled better and had better flavor, maybe a little salt or pepper next time? My dish also came with a small, not-so-appealing side of potatoes, but hey I love potatoes so I still enjoyed them- plus ketchup makes everything better! The hollandaise sauce was delicious though, so that brought the whole meal together. 

It's not as good as some of the other breakfast spots in that area, but it provided us with good food to fill out tummys and stay warm. Sometimes that is good enough!
author: Sonya D.

description:
After a long night out, we went searching for a  hangover cure in the form of home fries and eggs.

Seeing that Crepevine was too packed, we checked out Rain Tree which is on the same block.

Tiny, little decor, which usually means good food.  Super nice servers, who we overheard were from Romania.  We both ordered eggs florentine, which came with home fries.  Presentation was simple, did not look too fancy but was still pretty tasty.  Even the amount was just right.  

Left feeling satisfied, not stuffed.   Just what we needed.
author: Cassie B.

description:
OMG. stay away from this place. It's expensive and you get prefab waffles. The server is a complete scatterbrain and had to be asked multiple times for everything. I asked before I ordered if the waffle would be crispy and he had to think about it. That should have been a warning for me. When it came out, there was no butter. We had to ask three times for the butter. Eventually, I watched him climb up to the loft and come back down with a tub. How do you list waffles on your menu, and NOT have butter ready? The waffle didn't come out all that hot to begin with, but by the time we got the butter it was cold and hard. Yuck. We just left it. Horrid.

Another customer started hollering because apparently he hadn't gotten his toast. Instead of apologizing, and getting the man his toast, the server told him to get out in a very hostile tone.

It wasn't as if it was busy. There were maybe 7 people in total.
author: Edward J.

description: This is why you don't just walk around and say, "oh, that places looks decent, let's just go there."  This is what you get for ignoring Yelp.  You end up with tasteless eggs and bacon a dog might scoff at.  My pancakes were tasty enough, but this sort of diner fare is only acceptable in a town of 1000 or less.
author: Jeremy G.

description: Absolutely worse service ever. I ordered a #1 French toast special with bacon and easy over eggs. The cook stuck his hands in raw meat then picked up my cooked bacon  gross. He only wipes his hands clean on a rag in front of him , then uses the same rag to clean the insides of his pans. The waiter dropped the black plastic thing that they give you with your check into the pancake batter but then still used the batter. I sat there waiting 10 minutes just for my check, when people next to me got their check and they came after me  worse service & it feels so dirty in there. There's little bugs flying around open butter and open veggies.
author: Krista K.

description:
After spending the night in the Inner Sunset, I was up wanting to get a breakfast before shopping the rest of the day. There weren't too many people inside on a Saturday so we decided to sit down and eat. [seat yourself either at tables or at the bar]

Food;
California Omlette - the omlette was pretty good. The avocado and spinach were delicious. The plate was pretty big and included some potatoes. Those were good as well. At times they were a bit hard to pick up with my fork because they were crumbly I guess you could say. There was also toast, but I thought there was too much oil/butter on the toast already when they were toasting it. It was all over my hands. The jam they provided was good though - nothing like homemade jam, but good. 

Overall, I had a decent breakfast there. Enough to keep me shopping through the Union Square and Westfield area in heeled boots. Lots of exercise that day.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Nothing fancy, nothing special. What you see is what you get... 

Seeing how the dishes were kinda plain - I opted for a burger which was surprisingly really good. It was called the Nick's special or something. Came with mushrooms, goat cheese (I think it was, I forget) and side salad. As you can see, this café didn't make an impression... especially with so many nearby options. 

Food: menu had a bunch of options for both breakfast and lunch. 
Service: mediocre
Vibe: ehhh....
author: Michele H.

description: The food (plain burger and Hawaiian crepe) were less than ordinary.  Sat at counter by cook who was angry with server and was slamming orders down.  But the worst thing was that he climbed the ladder in the storage room, came back and put a new burger on the counter flattening it with his bare hand, without washing it. Yuck.  I will never go back
author: Paul N.

description: Came here for breakfast this morning and was a bit skeptical because I had read the reviews as I was sitting down. We ordered, everything seemed fine. Food was decent (I really enjoyed their onion rings). However, the waitress never gave me the milkshake I ordered right off the bat. Even though she stopped by our table and apologized for not getting my shake and stated she would make it right away, I never got it. In the end it was merely deducted from the check, and I never got an explanation as to why.
author: David H.

description: Waitresses here have absolutely no expression and service was bad. The burger was dry with no taste and the milkshake was 3/4 full. I definitely will not be back.
author: Mary L.

description:
Cafe Rain Tree is such a sweet, happy little place.  With so much going on in the surrounding area in the way of mind-blowing food, it can sometimes be hard to notice.  But if you're interested in solid, standard diner fare with a pleasant atmosphere and friendly service, Rain Tree is your place.

Most of my experience with Rain Tree was back when it was open in the evenings.  There was definitely a certain charm to its bright, friendly decor when it was dark outside and though I still enjoy going sometimes in the mornings, nothing's as great as breakfast at night.  Except maybe ponies.  Eating breakfast at night on a pony would trigger the apocalypse.

The fare at Rain Tree is very standard.  You have various arrangements of eggs, meat, and bread, and you have sandwiches that can all be served with avocado (thank you, California!).  I give it props for the crepe section on the menu, which is a very nice touch and goes a little beyond standard diner fare.  The way the food is executed is very standard - if you sit at the counter you can watch your food spluttering away on the griddle, which is always fun.  The last time I was at Rain Tree, I had an egg white omelet containing spinach, onion, mushroom, and sausage.  The bits containing sausage, as one might expect, were excellent!  But the rest was a little bland.  Part of me appreciates that, because it means it's just the basics and not a whole lot else.  But if you're looking for something with a bit more pizzazz, you may want to seek it elsewhere.

To be fair, if you're looking for particular elements or ingredients, I'm pretty sure the staff would be happy to accommodate you.  Everyone who has ever served me has been very friendly and has handled my requests like pros.  I think that says a lot, since in a lot of diners I've found myself more or less on my own.

I kind of feel like Cafe Rain Tree is the "little engine that could" of the Inner Sunset diner scene.  Does it have the rad moves of some of its elder brethren?  Nah.  Does it do just fine without?  You bet.
author: Becca S.

description:
The food is seriously mediocre, not inexpensive, and their waitstaff always seems to behave as though they've been lobotomized.  Simple basic food prep concepts, like how to make a milkshake that isn't completely melted and watery, are lost on this place, and don't even bother asking for any special preparation instructions on your dish!  

And above all, don't waste your time, money, or appetite on ordering take-out from this place - they'll consistently tell you the wrong amount of time it'll take to make your order, and so it'll be cold when you get there, nevermind when you get home!

To nitpick - they have the wrong phone number written on their website, and that's been the case for at least 4-5 months.  I've told them about this problem twice, and they never bother fixing it, even though if you call that number, you'll get the West Portal location, NOT the Irving location.  That's a big problem if you're ordering food to-go.  Which I won't be doing anymore, since I've learned after stubbornly forcing myself to make several attempts to like this place that it's just NOT WORTH IT!  There's a reason it's easy to get a table at this place...
author: Amy L.

description:
Nothing really special about this brunch joint. 

Came here two days in a row and there was a fair amount of people inside. Definitely more room than Art's Cafe but I feel like Art's is a bit better. 

The service is definitely very friendly. I have to give it up to the chef though. I was sitting on their brown stools eating at the counter while watching the cook quickly making everyone's orders nonstop. It was amazing. When he finally had a break, he turned to me and asked me how I was doing. It was nice of him to see how his customers are doing and whatnot. 

Food was very mediocre. The omelets are ok but compared to Mama's, it's like a more bland and shrunken down version. Mine had some spinach, tomato, cheese, and avocado but I felt like the tomato was lacking. Home fries were good and had a slight crisp on the outside. Toast was ok, nothing great. I got to taste their banana pancakes too. I took a bite and it had some chunks of banana in there. Tasted pretty good. 

If you're looking for a good breakfast joint, this is not a bad choice but also try Art's or Howard's too see which you prefer. Rain Tree has a nice window view for those sitting near the outside. If you're on one of the stools, just chat it up with the chef when he has time or the waitresses. Everyone is really friendly here.
author: robin w.

description:
My husband and I came here today because I've been wanting to try the Irish Breakfast.

We walk in, the Russian waitress didn't even look up, just waved her hand and said "sit anywhere"

She ignored us for a while and when she finally decided to grace us with her presence and glasses of warm tap water she got pushy. Wanted us to place our order OMGRIGHTNOW and actually got huffy when my husband had to actually think for a minute.

He ordered the double burger, medium well. thing came with two dinky slices of cheese and was literally bleeding on the plate when he bit into it.

I ordered the Irish Breakfast and was excited until it actually was in front of me. the puddings were measly and burnt, fry till crisp, not fry till they resemble chunks of charcoal. The sausage was bland to say the least, the ONE slice of tomato I got was half charred on one side and STILL COLD on the other, and it tasted like it had been frozen and thawed at least twice. eggs and potatoes were ok

Oh and the cook? was in the back processing dirty dishes, came out to start cooking and didn't bother to wash his hands.

we should have walked out when she got huffy and taken our $30 to a friendlier, tastier establishment
author: Cassandra L.

description: I was thinking my portions were small. Then both the people at the next table that their hash browns were barely 1/2 portions. Waitress could only say "I can't comp you food, cook won't, mgr doesn't let us." She was gracious and as nice as she could be. I like the diner setting but overall, not coming back.  Mgr/owner needs some tips on where to cut costs. Making your people haggle over portion size is lame.
author: Casey J.

description:
Great service! The place is cheap. I put 5 even if it is a 3.5/4 because I really believe that you get what you pay for. 
I got omelette with avocado and shrimp, the shrimp are not fresh but the whole dish was pretty ok.
author: Lorenzo N.

description: The wait staff is okay, the counters were dirty and the coffee mugs smelled funny.
author: Rick B.

description: The waitress was super rude, bad service. BF and I walked in here , sat ourselves down while she was texting and noticed us 10 minutes later. She then took our order and brought over a few cups of iced water. As our food was cooking, she made our toast after handling with money! I totally lost my appetite at that time and decided to take it to go and threw it away!
author: lala l.

description:
It's a simple breakfast...

Well it hurts to stand in the shadow of Art's cafe and it shows. R.T.C just does not make the cut in this neighborhood, I'm sure that the Irish breakfast might be good but gee it will be a dry day in the sunset before I try the Rain Tree Cafe again. 

I posted an image of my anemic breakfast.
author: swys -.

description: Don't eat here. No, seriously, just don't do it. The food is bad, the service is horrible, and you'll feel like a douche-pump after eating there. No personality, bad food.
author: Michael S.

description:
If I could give this place a negative star I would. I sat at the counter on a Sunday afternoon. The waitress was awful, she was rude and when I confronted her about a long women's hair in my home fries, she shrugged and said "oh, well I didn't charge you anyways". I had to wait 10 minutes to even confront her, as she never once stopped and asked us how our meal was or bothered to give us cream for our coffee, or jam for the toast. WORST MEAL EXPERIENCE EVER. 

On the positive side the cook is a very nice man, and I feel bad that he has to work with such negative people.
author: Melissa R.

description:
Food was decent, at best.  Lots of salt which helped to give some flavor.

Restaurant was fairly clean with old equipment for everything.

Wait staff and cook did not seem happy to be at work.

One waitress, when she arrived, pulled out her retainer behind the bar, put it in a napkin and into her pocket, and then proceeded to go serve customers...didn't bother to wash her hands after starting her shift...nor after her hands were in her mouth!

I will not be returning here anytime soon.
author: David H.

description:
Came in for brunch and the place was already pretty full.

California Crepe- delicious! the crepe itself wasn't too think or doughy. it was light and was the perfect counterpart to the cheese, spinach, avocado and tomatoes that were inside. plus a small salad. i wasn't full after eating the crepe but i was just right!
author: Candace H.

description:
Customer service was ghost-like: you see the people behind the counter but you couldn't communicate with them.

After the AIDS walk this year, I decided to hit this place up. Not bad but there's nothing to write home about. Had the California burger with fries which was pretty good but then again, almost anything after a 3.4 hour walk would taste pretty good. Just saying.
author: Brian I.

description:
Here on a weekend getaway from LA. It was raining. We were hungry. Lots of the cafes on Irving were crowded.  That's the story of how we ended up at Rain Tree Cafe.

I was kinda envisioning a cool, environmentally themed, tree-hugging type of vibe when I saw the cafe's name. Rain Tree. Seems quite Avatar-ish doesn't it? I was kinda bummed when I walked in. It seemed like your typical, old Americana diner, the kind you see in the middle of nowhere, like the desert, the kind of place destined to get attacked by zombies.

The wait staff bordered on nice and cold. Really couldn't decide. They were Russian and one of them was consistently being hit on by two older American men. Classic lines "Wow your name's Oksana? Were you named after the figure skater Oksana Baiul?" "Um, no. She and I are the same age." "Really? I just thought cuz you're both named Oksana!"  We really wanted to go over there, slap him and say "That's cuz Oksana's a common Russian name, dumbass."

The food was decent though, I have to say, and cheaper then the breakfast spots in LA.  I got the Joe's Special (although I have no idea who Joe is and the menu doesn't really explain Joe's whereabouts).  His special comes with eggs scrambled with ground beef, onions, mushrooms and spinach.  I was hopeful but the beef came out plain. Unseasoned. Maybe it's the Angeleno in me, when I hear ground beef I think tacos.  I think flavor. The potatos were home-fried but also unseasoned and the wheat toast was average and arrived pre-buttered. Reading other Yelp reviews, I will see that as a sign of stinginess.

My friend ordered blueberry pancakes, which he definitely enjoyed.  You can't go wrong with blueberry pancakes.

Highlights: $2.50 for a latte. Decent sized, about a 12 oz. Not bad.  Oh, and of course the guys hitting on the poor waitress.
author: Sara S.

description: Not the worst place I've ever eaten, but everything was sub-par. Most of the food seems right out of a can. The food is prepared and served with a healthy dose of "meh". Pluses, It was fast and there's probably never a wait, so if you need food in a hurry it may be an option, just don't say I didn't warn you.
author: Rob M.

description:
This place gets the job done

As pros, they:
-have decent hours
-accept credit cards
-serve their food fast
-never have a wait for a table
