-have pricing that is not so bad
-are in a good location

Cons:
-they are more expensive then their cooler competition
-the waitress collects money and then makes toast
author: lily l.

description:
The last time I had eaten anything substantial was 18 hours earlier. During that time I had flown to Vegas, danced to Markus Schulz at the not so good Rain (http://www.yelp.com/biz/rain-nightclub-las-vegas#hrid:BWpCf_r5jJaGP-n4Vw0cxQ), flown back, and fell asleep about thirty seconds after hitting my bed. I was hungry. Very hungry.

That said, anything was going to taste good, which makes the just OK French toast a bit disappointing. I really wanted to like it more considering the friendly service, reasonable price ($6) and generous amount (6 slices).

They earn a third star for all the extras, despite the food itself not being worth a trip across state lines to consume.
author: Jason B.

description: After being out of the area for nearly 13 years, my fiance and I recently had a wonderful breakfast here!  Although it was late morning, we received good service and were simply delighted with the food!  We will definitely be back!
author: Peter B.

description:
Totally disappointing meal. I had the Irish breakfast, which consisted of two tiny sausages, the uber processed kind you ate as a kid, two thin slices of mealy tomato, bland undercooked tomatoes, overcooked eggs and toast that sat right in front of us on the counter, but she never gave us) we didn't wan't it anyway. The hubs had pancakes, which looked good, but were no better than Bisquick. 

I mean, ladies who run this place, why bother running such a crappy place? Don't you have any pride? What's the point? This place could be so great, and there is a dearth of cool, eclectic breakfast places in the Inner Sunset. Please improve or sell. Really.
author: jessica d.

description: soggy potatoes, bland omelette, broken hollandaise sauce, enough said.
author: Joyce C.

description: I think that this chain is good for breakfast, when you are in a hurry. Its cheap, there are 2 locations near me and my route to work. Convenient. They take Credit Cards.
author: Elon R.

description:
The service was a cross between rude and non-existent. We sat at the booth and were ignored. The waitress wiped the counter right in front of us, and didn't acknowledge us at all. Two parties that were seated after us received menus and utensils. When the waitress finally acknowledged us, she simply said, "It'll be a few more minutes." The other waitress finally gave us our menus and asked for our orders within a minute. The cook prepared our breakfasts right in front of us and finished both at the same time. The surly waitress gave us one meal and left the other on the inside counter 3 feet away from my reach. I sat there for 5-10 minutes just looking at my meal get cold. When she served our meals, she left the plates on the opposite side of our coffee. We had to reach over to move our plates to eat it. 
   The food was average. Nothing special. The service was exceptional - exceptionally bad!
author: Kelvin Q.

description: Exceptional wait staff.  Delicious breakfast.  NOT greasy (even if you get the irish breakfast).  We love Rain Tree and go out for breakfast at least every other week.  A great diner, located in a brilliantly sunny spot.  Love love love.
author: Gregarious B.

description:
We decided to try this place again after finding our favorite Howard's packed as usual. A bad decision!

We waited for the waitress to come by and clean the table and give us the menu, but she chose to take orders from three parties who arrived after us, even though she saw me eyeing her that we were ready to order.  Finally we got up and left -- went to Darla's instead, which was a far better experience!
author: K S.

description:
S'alright. No hidden agendas, so you get what you pay for and the iced tea is really nice. Location is awesome, since this cafe is usually not as busy as Irving Street. And it's similar food at a similar price. 

I remember having an omelette my first time in, and the french toast the second time. Both yummy.
author: Elizabeth Z.

description: Never opens on time. The posted business hours are 7am-4pm. Their 'open' sign will be lit, but their front door stays looked until well after 730. If you're hungry and want have breakfast before heading out for the day, go elsewhere as they won't be ready for your business.
author: Angel R.

description:
We came on a Sunday morning, so naturally, it was busy. They also only have maybe 8 tables and a bar top, so expect at least a little bit of a wait on weekends. 

The food was decent, nothing special. The price was average for a breakfast place. There is only 2 servers for the whole place and one cook, so service was pretty much non-existent. 

If you're looking for a no fuss, get your food and go kinda place, this is the place for you.
author: Tiffany K.

description: Just got handed the most disgusting Irish breakfast I have ever seen in my life , wow is all I can say , when you are charging $13.50 for a breakfast and advertising on the window of your store the best Irish breakfast around , it should be that, stick to what you know rain tree, if not for the very nice lady that was out server,  I would would completely write this place off. I gave back my $13.50 breakfast , for a $9 bacon and eggs American style, bacon and eggs were good but the potato were still hard and undercooked , I'll never come back.
author: Scott B.

description: Horrendously slow,rude service. The food was brought over at room temp and when the bill came they tried to slip extras on the menu. We had it corrected. We paid our bill. $23.32 with tip. A few days later I checked my bank account to find that my account was charged 30.42. What did they do to deserve an extra $7.10 tip? AVOID!!!!
author: Chloe W.

description: Found this nice place by accident, so delighted we tried it. Rosemary on the fried potato side dish (fantastic) was a great addition, the Eggs Florentine were nicely done and not to large or too small a portion. Would definately come again if in the neighborhood.
author: Sharon C.

description: Service was good but food was very mediocre. We had an omelette and a sausage and egg breakfast. Location is convenient but I'd probably try another cafe next time.
author: Queena T.

description: The service and staff were wonderful and made us feel right at home. A great place to people watch and enjoy a casual breakfast. Any place that puts rosemary on their home fries is good by me!
author: Michelle S.

description: The hollindaise sause is incredible. The rest of the food isnt too bad either. Nothing on the menu will ever blow your mind but it will still be sufficiently yummy.
author: Nelson S.

description: If I could give this place no stars, I would!!!! Nasty food with the worst service ever! I'm talking about the Russian waitress with the short blonde hair! Seriously, if you are going to cough, please cough away and not on top of my head and straight at my 3 yrs old's face! No manners and totally rude. Oh yea, you are more then willing to take my money at end and not even a thank you! You suck waitress! And because of you, we are NEVER coming back back there again!
author: Hanh B.

description:
$5.50 for frenchtoast/pancakes, eggs, sausage. good deal !!

Randomly found this spot, and was deciding between this and a neighboring restaurant (that had more yelp stars). We chose this one, because it was cleaner, and more sunlight came in.

Pretty good... it does the job if you're hungry. Waitress was nice. Seemed to be a place where it holds a few "regulars" who come in. 

It's aiiiiight!
author: Charla A.

description:
I'm giving this place 3 stars and this is why:

There are things to be said for the basics and this place is all basics. There is probably 6-8 tables and bar stools to sit it and the interior must have been less than glamorous because I can't remember a single detail about it with the exception of a chalk board that had their specials on it. 

I had breakfast there recently and saw one person serving and a cook. The table I sat at had a spilled jam on it and it looked like it had been there for awhile. Um, clean your tables much? The menu is very simple and that's fine. The food tasted good but clearly there is no effort on presentation. Our server lacked any sort of personality but that's fine as long as you're efficient and good at what you do. This person delivered.

A basic diner at a good price. Don't expect to impress a date here but a good place for a quick meal on the go.
author: Gabriel R.

description:
Tuna Melt, get the tuna melt.  The pancakes are good too.  
this place is too small for booths or numerous waitress.  You may have to wait for a table, but not that long.  It's a quaint greasy spoon that isn't that greasy.  It's one of my favorite places to go on a sunday morning.  Hung over or not.
author: amanda v.

description:
I've been here a couple of times and let me assure you that this place is better than it's West Portal location for sure. They pretty much serve the same items so I knew was to expect for the most part but the thing that stands out the most is thee atmosphere. Even though the place is quite small by many standards I like the feel of being able to sit at the counter to have a meal. It brings back memories of home cooking in the burbs. The waitress was real nice always making sure we were taken care of and I like how there's a lot of ambient lighting around.

I decided to come here with some friends for breakfast and it was pretty good. The corn beef hash wasn't too salty and it was perfectly cooked along with a side of sunny side up eggs and some bacon on the side as well. Add a cup of orange juice and our meal was complete. I know there are tons of places to choose from in the area but if you want something reasonable this is the place to go. It's not too expensive either so come here if you feel like a new experience.
author: Jason Y.

description:
Mmmm Bacon. The bacon is damn good here. That earns it 4 stars instead of just 3.

Otherwise pretty average place. Decent service, good breakfast, a good variety of seating, but nothing fancy. Prices seemed reasonable.

It sits on the corner of Irving and 8th, so you can get a window seat and see some of the outside world, if you so choose to. Good luck on the parking, as usual, but there is a lot across the street and street parking isn't too bad during breakfast, which is when I'd suggest you go here.
author: Andrew M.

description:
You'd think that with the fierce competition for weekend yuppie breakfast dollars in the Inner Sunset that this place would at least be decent. Unfortunately, no one at the Rain Tree got that memo.

I don't think any of the seats had upholstery in any state other than horrible and torn. The entire place had a dingy, crappy quality. At this point my thought process was along the lines of, "Holy Shit- the food must be awesome! They don't even need to clean their restaurant very well, or keep things in a state at all resembling 'repair'!"

Flash forward to the food, and it can be best summarized as stingy portions, yet also severely lacking in quality.

Oh, and a small glass of orange juice was like $2.25. With all the other good places to eat along Irving Street, this place's days are numbered.
author: Antony M.

description:
I work in the area so I'm always on the lookout for a good breakfast place for when I can't be bothered to cook. I've tried Rain Tree several times. Usually the food is just blah, sometimes it's burnt. The service really varies from visit to visit. Some of the waitresses are attentive but there have been days where I've had to call out to get service.

All-in-all not inedible in a pinch but you'd be much better off at Art's or the Irving Street Cafe.
author: Sam H.

description:
I had high hopes for the Irish Breakfast: purportedly a plateful of eggs, black and white pudding, irish bacon, sausage and potatoes... while indeed plentiful, the food was, for the most part, bland and tasteless (with the exception of the white boudin irish "pudding").

Of the many breakfast places on or near Irving St., this should be a last choice.
author: Claudine C.

description: I hate seeing their rating so low. For years now they've served us reliable diner food at cheap prices with friendly service.
author: Cassie P.

description:
This is a place where you want a Do-Over when you are finished with your meal.  A Do-Over where you go back in time and decide not to eat here. 

First of all, the wait staff seemed stoned.  A stoned in that "i need to escape reality" kind of way.  Actually everyone in the place seemed to have an  "i need to escape reality" kind of vibe. 

So the service was obviously extra slow and spacey.  Where you wondered if they actually herd what you ordered or if they would come back in 5 minutes to take your order all over again.   And then just when you are certain they actually took your order you start wondering if they then remembered to give it to the cook.  Because it took over 20 minutes took cook eggs for two people in a nearly empty diner. 

And then when the food arrived it was just bad.  Warm, bland, and it too had a "i need to escape reality" vibe.

I ate here over a two months ago and I still want a Do-Over for that morning's brunch.  I mean,  just look at the photo that accompanies this diner's yelp page.  That one with the sausage.
author: Kristin S.

description:
eh, it's alright. unfortunately, for the array of choices one has for breakfast within 3 blocks of this place, this probably shouldn't be your first choice. can't speak of their lunch or dinner though...

had a fine experience here, nothing specific to complain about, but have had a better breakfast down the street. would consider going back but it won't be a place I frequent and will definitely not be writing home about it any time soon.
author: Georgia W.

description:
Here's what went down. The waitress comes over the SECOND we sit down and asks for drinks. That's fine - most people know what they want to drink off the bat. So I say my date and I would each like a water to start and he butt's in with a coffee as well. I say, "Make it to coffees" 
So while we wait for the coffee and water, we look through the menu. Basic breakfast stuff with some fun extras like crepes and salmon scrambles. Waitress returns with two waters. and asks if we are ready to order. I get a Royal Burger with fries and my date gets a Salmon Scramble. He asks for a coffee again and I chime in Again with "Make that 2 coffees" 
While we wait for our coffees again and now our meal, we watch some homeless woman outside pester people on the street for change and try to tune out some EXTREMELY loud patrons. Coffee is starting to a while and I look up to ask our server again. She appears with our meal...no coffee. We AGAIN ask for a coffee and she clarifies if we want 1 or 2 - I THINK we made it clear we wanted two. She returns with 1 and is never to be seen again. 
REALLY?!?! Not even to check on how our food is. Not until we stack our own plates and my date has long since given up on getting a refill on his now empty cup. She clears the plates. Fills his coffee and drops the bill. DONE. 
The food was only mediocre. I really did not like the egg on my burger runny. I have ordered Royal Burgers before and never had a runny egg. The Salmon Scramble I was told was only ok and they tried to hide the fact that the bread was completely burnt black on one side. No thanks. 
Bottom line is - Service was friendly but still awful (who forgets your coffee three times with a virtually empty restaurant?) and the food was ok priced, but nothing I would go back to. I sat and looked over are ARTS CAFE - mad at myself for not going back there.
author: Jena D.

description:
Not the worst breakfast I've had.  The homefries bumped it up a star.  They were really delicious, big chunks of potatoes with just the right amount of crunch and no strange seasoning.

Oatmeal was creamy, but nothing special and a small portion.  

The folks working were a bit zoned out, but service was OK.

Next time I'm in this area, I'll try another place.  There's plenty of options.
author: Dina B.

description:
Seriously gross enough to lift my year-long yelp review silence.

The bathroom really set the tone for the whole establishment. 


yuck.
author: Mariah V.

description:
Irish Breakfast....what the hell is that?  Sure why not....I like trying new things.  

Irish sausage.....meh.  Irish bacon.....decent.  Grilled Tomatoes...wha??

Black and White Pudding....uh...its actually two tiny meat patties. wtf?  

I don't get it...It was a greasy and salty breakfast so I loved it but nonetheless...I don't get it.
author: Jay H.

description: I went in today and had an awesome Bacon Cheese Burger.  I got served by a beautiful redhead who must be an angel the way she dealt with one of the goofy old ladies that is probably a regular...  Good food, Good service, Good job Rain Tree Cafe!
author: glenn g.

description: Brutal. I was starving and didn't want to wait in line at my favorite breakfast place in the Inner Sunset. I figured it is pretty hard to mess up breakfast, but boy was I wrong.  The quality of their ingredients is pretty low, and their prices certainly don't reflect that (um, Kraft American cheese slices? ick). And to top it off I found a giant hair in my omelet. I will not be back here.
author: Gillian M.

description:
So, for reasons I won't go into, I am spending a good deal of time at UCSF.  The food court and the cafeteria leave a bit to be desired especially on the weekends.

So, we went on a brunch hunt this AM and saw the word "cafe".  DONE.

So in we go and to my pleasant surprise, I am treated to, well I paid, but am treated to some of the best blueberry pancakes I have ever had.  My wife had some quasi eggs Benedict thing with cheddar cheese instead of hollandaise and was not pleased.  I am not a fan of egg yolk so I don't do poached eggs, but she said there was no yolk at all and thus it was very dry.  She ended up eating some of my melt in your mouth pancakes.  

I really wanted to give this place 5 stars since the service was swift and polite even though there was only one waitress working the entire room, but I can't give out 5 stars if you can't poach an egg.

I will go back...
author: B G.

description:
I got food here once or twice and had been inside a time or two other then that but decided there were too many other places in the area then to bother with this place.

The food and prices is comparable to M's and Irving St...they seem to all make generally the same items.  But the waitress that used to work there (still does?  no idea) is just plain rude.  She gave me cold looks, ignored me and was just generally unpleasant.
author: J T.

description:
Banana pancakes! yum!  and no it's not butter pancakes with fresh bananas on top.  
It's just a regular neighborhood breakfast place with exceptional service and pricing.  
If you're looking for a place to wind down on a Sunday and you don't want a fancy snooty service place, this is where you want to be.  You can't beat the price anywhere.  The CA omelette was also really really good.  Fresh ingredients and decent pricing.  A great jewel in the sunset.

too bad I didn't get to be the first to review it.
author: AhLin C.

description: This place is not good. If you want a good breakfast in this area, Go to Irving Street Cafe or Howard's cafe! I had blueberry pancakes that didnt even taste like blueberry pancakes... they tasted like bread. eggs are the same everywhere, sausages had to from safeway or something. I could make a better breakfast... what a waste of space. Ummm, what else can I say, Oh yea... when i got there i sat at the diner stool and wasnt given a menu, I had to get it myself and was only acknowledged when I said "excuse me" and there were only 2 other customers... BOO to this place!
author: Dora Z.

description: The breakfasts are a decent size for what you pay for.  There are a ton of choices and the location is pretty easy to find.  I got a crepe which they seem to have a bunch to choose from.  Our server was very pleasant.  Just your average cafe.  Nothing special.
author: Amy J.

description: The sandwich I got here was really good! I could tell they over-married the ketchup though -- you could tell it was starting to ferment.
author: Jennifer P.

description: The burgers were large and really well cooked! Very Tasty! There was some kind of really bad smell that showed up halfway through the meal, like a dirty dish towel smell; but it really wasn't that big a deal. Didn't spoil the great food anyway! Also, the waitress who served us was extremely patient with an elderly woman who was on her own and having trouble remembering where she was. It was nice to see.
author: Mason H.

description:
Here we go again another Sunday, another try at my favorite meal of the week Brunch.  

I was hoping to save some cash from going to Crapvine again, but I probably should have boarded the flight to commonville at Crapvine.  

Food was super "eh".  Been there before, and I probably could have made the same damn meal myself with 3 bucks and a trip to Safeway.  If only I wasn't so lazy.  

I'm pretty sure the wait staff would be glad with a gunpoint robbing because they looked like the folks whom I drank with the night before, only they didn't get the 3 hours of sleep.  Maybe if I held them at gunpoint they would have got me my damn drink faster, I don't know.  

Maybe I could have done the Pulp Fiction thing and tell everybody to get on the floor.  Maybe next time, if there is a next time.
author: patrick o.

description:
There are a few foods that are basically hit-or-miss. Some places can cook'em, some can't, and you're rolling the dice whenever you order one of these items from an unfamilar restaurant. The first would be chicken salad. The second would be spinach. The third would be hash. 

I'm not sure whether Raintree serves chicken salad or spinach, but luckily it has found its own recipe for a fantastic hash. The potatoes are chopped pretty fine, and the corned beef's been cooked in an irrestible blend of spices. 

And while you're at it, get the blueberry pancakes. They're bananas.
author: Andrew K.

description: Rude waitress who acted life she was doing us a favor, slow service, meh food. Extra star for no wait to be seated, good coffee, location. Won't go back
author: B G.

description:
If one day you happen to wake well before lunchtime and you're too lazy or stove-challenged (like me) to scramble some eggs, Raintree is a neat little place for breakfast or brunch.

It's my go-to breakfast nook in the city when all I want are some delicious fluffy blueberry pancakes or omelets  without the frills and fuss.  It's practically the default choice for my best friend and me when we do our weekly catch-ups.

This place is definitely not pretentious.  It's your typical, decent neighborhood mom and pop breakfast diner -- and maybe because these are so far and few (esp. in the city), I happen to appreciate it a little more.

It's lightly staffed, just the friendly cook and warm waiter Sunny with his bright early morning smile and attentiveness, so it could get crazy on the weekends.  We usually go on Thursdays (random, I know).  The locals are just as down to earth and friendly.  It's not breakfast at Mama's, but it's better than the franchise feel of IHOPs or Denny's.

I've never had to wait and our favorite booth is always ready and open for us.  By our third visit, Sunny has our order preferences down and even greets us personally from the counter the moment we walk through the door.

Now for the food:

*I usually like the Mediterranean scramble when I want something light, the feta cheese and artichoke hearts are its highlights.  

*The omelets are huge -- don't be deceived by the neat way the cook arranges your plate.  Believe me, there were many foolish mornings when I thought I could finish my omelet order and more only to wish my yoga pants had more give!  

* Other great omelets are The Denver and the Shrimp and Avocado.

Of course, the blueberry pancakes are great too and so are the waffles.

Each order comes with generous sides of toast and jam, home potatoes...and more that I can't remember at the moment - but it's all there.  

By the way, contrary to some experiences, Sunny always refills our mugs and glasses way before they're even scraping empty and our toast is almost always delightfully crispy when it arrives.
author: Melissa H.

description:
A nice little corner street restaurant that serves good breakfast all day.  I've been here a few times and honestly every time I've been there, the servers have been friendly and attentive.  It has a familiar family atmosphere and serves a lot of different type of foods.  When I go there, I usually ordered their Irish breakfast which consists of 2 Irish Sausages, 2 Bacon strips, a Black & White Pudding, Grilled tomatoes, grilled potatoes, and 2 eggs of your choice...all for $9.95!

I also tried their fettuccine pasta there called the Chicken Milano....let me say the sauce is thick and tasty enough to make me keep coming back for more.  Their breakfast menu has a wide range of the usual eggs, sausages, waffles and pancakes combo and you can never go wrong with their Hot Choco. The long, narrow interior consists of several small tables set against a window, and a substantial bar lined with wooden stools so it's a pretty small and family-oriented place.  They are so old-fashioned...they still have the RV antennas attached to their TV when they are watching el futbol on telemundo....now that's dope!

Definitely try out their "Irish Breakfast"
author: Dave L.

description:
I couldn't find anything good about this place, nor anything bad about this place. As such, three stars.

The portions were sufficient to tide me over for six hours. Had pancakes, sausage, eggs. Nothing remarkable there. It's one of those places where you can basically go to eat what you could make for yourself at home. If you're feeling lazy, hungry, and have $8 to drop, this place will work jsut fine. 

Coffee? Alas, it tasted burned. I never understood what it meant when people said that the coffee tasted "burned." Well, now I know. 

The place was fine. Inexpensive. Tasty enough. Convenient.
author: Marc P.

description:
The local breakfast joint, with some Irish food specialties. Really, black and white pudding is not my "breakfast of champions", but hey each to his/her own! I have been here a number of times because despite their small size they do serve at a decent rate and the prices are reasonable. Plus they have eggs benedict. And anyone knowing me knows I have this terrible weakness for hollandaise sauce. So, two eggs any style + hollandaise. French toast + hollandaise. Eggs benedict + avocado + mushroom + hollandaise. Yeah, pretty much everything + hollandaise.

So, it's good, quick, fast, and reasonable. Coffee not very strong.

Times visited: 3
author: Amy L.

description:
my friend's cats could make a better breakfast than this joint.

DONT EAT HERE. SERIOUSLY.

my 'food' (and i use that term loosely) came with a blueberry muffin (from costco) that tasted like it was on the verge of going bad. it had that freezer burn taste that they tried to mask by warming it up. by chance, i happened to flip it over and there was MOLD on the bottom of the wrapper. 

fucking disgusting.

i'm not lying. go see pics of it here:
http://i8that.wordpress.com/
author: eve l.

description:
Being a long-time neighborhood "diner-type" place, I had expected something more quaint and comforting than Mel's, Video Cafe, or Lucky Penny....

Unfortunately, it wasn't a very pleasurable experience.  My friend ordered the eggs Benedict and parts of the poached eggs was cold so must have been sitting in water for a bit before she got it.  I ordered a turkey-burger and it was definitely not a natural patty, meaning it was rubbery and tasted nothing like ground meat.  It tasted worse than a frozen patty from Whole Foods.  That says a lot.
author: Susan C.

description:
Just look at the photos of the breakfast on this page. The food tastes the way those photos look, drab and tasteless. I don't know how you can mess up eggs, I had the Denver omelette, but some how they did. 

It's too bad, because they have a very clean looking diner with cool paintings of pop icons on the wall, and a VERY cool painting of Cannonball Adderley. 

Our server was fast but a little indifferent towards us. But I wasn't expecting much for a breakfast at a diner in the sunset so I really do not mark them down for that. 

Food = 1, Service = 3, Decor = 3 Overall = 2.
author: Ray R.

description: Meh, I've had better really sums this place up. Its tiny so don't expect to be seated if your party is bigger than 4 people, and even then it will be tough. I had eggs benedict with no ham and it was easily one of the worst eggs benedicts I have ever had. The hollandaise sauce was flavorless, and the home fries were also really bland. Cheap, but you'd probably be better of at Dennys. The coffee was alright.
author: Katharine E.

description:
This place used to be an Inner Sunset tradition.  Unfortunately, it went through an ownership change a couple of years ago...and it now...stinks.

At this point, they don't even have enough business to stay open for dinner anymore....the place used to be busy all day long.

Small portions, very nondescript food.  It's a shame how a new proprietor can take an established greasy-spoon and drive it into the ground by cutting corners.

There are half a dozen better breakfast/lunch dives on Irving St.
author: El K.

description:
Made our first visit here today, and was pleasantly surprised.  All three of us were happy with our orders:  Sunset crepe (smoked salmon), Portobella Mushroom on english muffin, and Eggs Florentine.  Tastier than I expected.  Also had an excellent espresso milkshake.

The home fries were just OK.  No problems with the service or cleanliness that others here have referred to.  I think this place is worth coming to from other neighborhoods.
author: G M.

description:
Portions are ok, prices are ok, service is bad.  Why would you eat here when there are so many other gOOd brekky places near by??  Well, we parked right in front and we were hungry.

We went in and nobody was in there except one guy.  The service was slow.  Had to ask the girl for coffee every time.  The bacon looked like it was cooked to death. yuk.  Not coming back here and you shouldn't either.  Go to Irving St cafe!
author: Serena H.

description:
This is your basic small cafe/diner. 
 
I sat at the counter where you can watch the cook make everything.

I ate french toast and bacon, can't get anymore basic than that. French toast was pretty good -thick texas style bread. Nothing to rave about tho.

The whole 3 people working there didn't seem too thrilled about having to work on a sunday morning so I wouldn't exactly say they were friendly but by no means rude. 

This place was pretty mediocre over all but it was decently priced and not crowded. Definitely better than a Denny's so if I was in the area again and wanted some breakfast i might go back.
author: Ashley T.

description:
have you ever been so disappointed that you had to eat again just to forget?? i went to Zazie's to have brunch but the line was super long w/an hour wait so we said screw it. we decided to go somewhere close by and found parking. 
the whole experience was a little odd, had a Swedish waitress who came really close to my face when taking my order, couldn't tell me if anything was good. i ordered egg florentine w/spinach on an english muffin. the english muffin was burnt but couldn't see it b/c it was covered w/spinach and poached egg. once i bit into it then i realized how hard it was. the potatoes were completely burnt as well. also, the water they gave me was warm. 
just to satisfy my stomach i had to come home and eat something else.
author: Deb C.

description: Yuck. Hard to believe this place has been here for as long as it has been. Had the misfortune of sitting at the bar, watching them prepare all dishes. Potato salad came from a safeway store, used "prego" spaghetti sauce for some type of omelet and store bought OJ. That's from just the 30 minutes I was sitting there. Russian server gave me mad sass. No bueno.
author: Jessica U.

description:
While wandering at about 8pm looking for food but not quite a full dinner we couldn't decide what we wanted. We were between Nachos and an Irish breakfast (I have been craving pudding since a return home at Christmas!). What are the chances of wandering into a cafe that does both? and well?

This place is a cafe. So the atmosphere is what you should expect from a cafe. The service was great and fast and the menu was pretty extensive (Mexican / Burgers / Sandwiches / Crepes / and the all important ALL DAY Irish Breakfast!)

If you're looking for a dinner experience - this is not it. But what is does (Breakfast / Lunch / snacks / Diner-like food) it does very well.

I'll be back next time we want Nachos and White pudding :D
author: Anita W.

description:
My friend and I were hungry for breakfast food and walked into this place. This place had good prices and decent food. I got the California omlette and that was pretty good. It was decently portioned and I enjoyed my breakfast. 

The service could be improved and so can the food but it is decent though.
author: Josephine N.

description:
Ok I think I went here years ago... when I lived in the 'set, and I remember it being good. It was terrible. Uncooked eggs in my omelette... not cool. And there were 2 mushrooms, uncooked onions 6 leaves of spinach and 1/4 of a chicken apple sausage. MEAGER. Oh yeah and the potatoes tasted like NOTHING.
skip this one
author: Burne D.

description:
Rain Tree Cafe is a good place for some basic diner-like food. Prices are reasonable, service is friendly. 

Rain Tree is a good place for breakfast. 

Meter parking is available but hard to find as Irving Street is very busy.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
if there was 2 or 3 people working then it would be a 2 star for me in my book..but there was only man working...

he did everything....wait, cook, and cashier while doing it all with a smile on his face. 

Yeah the food was alright..nothing worth mentioning but seeing this one man working it by himself and still smiling just hit me with something. I felt happy knowing that he was enjoying his job. And it just made me enjoy the mediocre food just a bit more..

in case you are wondering what we had...we had a monte cristo and a club sandwich..monte cristo was interesting considering we never had it before...think french toast sandwich..and the club sandwich was a regular club sandwich..

and who was the we? well of course me n my lady~
author: phillip w.

description: I love this little corner resturant in Inner Sunset! The service is always friendly and unpretentious and the diner food arrives hot and delicious.
author: K. D.

description: Not bad- I saw a lot of signs saying "We're Irish" but was kind of confused because the servers that day were Russian. Not that any of this matters in a diner situation- waffles are gigantic and pretty tasty. Kind of Expensive compared to Irving Street Cafe.
author: John S.

description:
Can I say blah, blah, yuck. WTF. Over priced and half cooked diner food. I went there today. Not the first place on my list, but Crepe Vine was closed. 

The service is poor, the food sucks (unless you like to clog your arteries with lard). Eggs over easy were served undercooked, the bacon was burnt, and the potatoes tasted like they were from a frozen TV dinner. The pancakes sucked too. 2 Lightly powdered 6 inch pies that were thin and priced at $4.95. How can anyone mess up pancakes?

Service really sucked. We returned the eggs and they came back 20 minutes later. The walls, tables and chairs were all sticky with grease. What a dump. 

If you are looking for a diner experience there are plenty of other places to go that serve you over sized portions at good prices.

I don't recommend this place unless you are dying to eat a cube of butter smothered in lard topped with a mediocre service experience.

If you have kids don't bother...no kids menu.
author: J A.

description: If zero or negative stars were possible, that would be my preference.  I ordered the salmon burger.  It came out chard to a crisp on the outer edge, blackened with bitter charcoal texture/flavor.  Within this ring of bitter ash was layers of variably squishy "salmon" with a fishier than usual flavor - to the point where I questioned the safety of what I was eating.  It took two bites, one of the char, one of the central squishy fishy mess, to realize it was inedible.  It clearly was some old supply of discount salmon burgers stuck in the back of the freezer, likely coated in icy crystals.  I asked the waitress for it to be remade and I could see fear in her eyes.  I watched her interaction with the cook and it was clearly one of annoyance, dismissal, and then anger.  She returned saying that it was prepared as well as it could ever be done - the cook would not be preparing another.  I asked if I could order something different in its place, even a small appetizer or cup of soup.  I was told I would be paying for that as well.
author: Kabir S.

description: Simple, non-pretenious, solid food.  Very nice staff, nice locale in iInner Sunset - and a nice alternative to the "brunch scene."  If you want a nice breakfast to fuel you through a day of recreation - this is a viable and competitive option.
author: Adam D.

description:
Nothing fancy here. Eat here for breakfast on the weekends with family. A nice neighborhood joint - they always remember my daughter and what I eat (waffle, decaf coffee).

It can get pretty busy on the weekends.
author: Matt F.

description:
Do NOT be fooled by the quaint appearance that this place may have, it is a total rip off.

I ordered an 7 dollar ham and cheese sandwich and my friend ordered a coffee because their espresso machine was broken. Our waitress could barely speak English, but she was nice so I didn't mind too much. However, the food was awful, the sandwich was soggy with grease and they used American cheese, which is ok when your mom makes it and you've five years old, but a little bit of a disgrace at an actual restaurant. The coffee, I tasted it, was somewhere between Folgers and Maxwell House. The french fries (which came with my sandwich) were straight out of the freezer bag and onto the plate. oh man, this place sucked.

Honestly, this place was a total rip and I would only recommend it to the tasteless and wealthy.
author: Inigo M.

description: I though this place was decent for a quick, inexpensive breakfast.  Oatmeal was very good.  My bf's veggie omelette was tasty.  Waitress was very sweet.
author: Rachel B.

description: Trying to find a place to eat in this city on a weekend morning that doesn't involve a list or an hourlong wait can be such a freaking nightmare. Thankfully, unpretentious places like Raintree exist where there is no scene and it's all about the giant portions of your standard american diner food. Totally not gourmet but if you're just going to go back home to lay on your couch and watch true hollywood story on E!, who cares??
author: Maria D.

description: Upon someone's reccommendation I walked into The Rain Tree Cafe for the Irish Breakfast at noon. I asked if it was too early for an Irish Breakfast and the server smiled and said no it's not it's midday. "Oh really?" 2 Eggs, 2 Bacon, 2 Sausage, Potates and A fried tomato will do wonders for a man's constitution.
author: George M.

description:
This is natural food, cooked without a ton of chemicals. Potatoes are to die for. 

Really small portions for the price, but a great breakfast place nonetheless.
author: John B.

description: This is a solid breakfast choice.  I wish there were booths, or if there are booths, I don't remember them as such because they were uncomfortable.  The service is attentive, and it's in a good spot for people watching.
author: John S.

description: We moved to Sunset a few months ago and have been trying the different places to eat -- and I would say that this is the one place we will NEVER go back to. The bacon was totally burnt and smelled like old grill grease, the eggs were overcooked, the toast was soggy, I think even the water tasted bad.... We sat at the bar and as we were leaving (with lots of food left on our plates) a person sitting next to us said "not very good, is it?"... no kidding!
author: kevin f.

description:
internal dialogue I wished I blurted out to the waitress:  "How are you gonna give me my bill, without giving me my food first?"

sad to say, we waited 25 minutes or more to just have our orders placed on the cook's queue.  

when I asked for a coffee refill... she gave me half a cup only.  wtf?

food was not bad... better than average.  coffee was aight.
author: Grace M.

description:
where to start?  ok.  the beginning.  i've lived in this neighborhood for about 15 years now.  i've never been to raintree, never really had reason to.  but friday morning, me and my boyfriend called in sick to work.  and i thought we needed a little breakfast.  for some reason, i thought i'd give raintree a try.

i called in my order.  a denver omelet and a california omelet, both with whole wheat toast.  the lady on the phone asks "what kind of toast do you want with the denver omelet?"  i tell her whole wheat, for both orders.  then she asks me what kind of toast i want with the california omelet.  i tell her whole wheat.

she starts to hang up the phone, so i ask her how long my order will take.  she says 'i dunno, 5 minutes?' ... great, i'm walking over now.

i get the doggie ready to go, and we walk over.  i actually get there in about 10 minutes.  when i walk in, i tell her that i phoned in an order.  (wait, i forgot to mention that there is ONE other person in the cafe.  it is NOT busy at all) ... she puts a glass of water down in front of me at the bar.  i tell her again that i'm just here to pick up my order.  she hands me a menu.  so i order.  a denver omelet and a california omelet -- both with whole wheat toast.  'what kind of toast with the denver omelet' she asks.  sigh.  whole wheat with both orders.  'what kind of toast with the california omelet?'  -- sigh.  whole wheat.

eventually i got my food.  two omelets cost about $21.00 with tax and a tip (the kitchen guy was on it).

the food was mediocre, to say the least.  actually, neither of us liked it at all, really, although my puppy was quite keen on the hash browns.   i probably will never go there again.  i just can't figure out why i did this time ...
author: cheryl f.

description: similar like the one in west portal, but I think this one is a lil bit cleaner. So I give 'em 3 stars
author: Albert W.

description: A place for great food? Of course not. Bloody Marys? Sorry Jack, no bar. It's just a simple American breakfast place. A very polite and friendly staff and a standard diner menu. They just raised their prices otherwise I would mention that it's a good deal. Almost never very busy, except for Sunday brunch times, it's just a nice place for breakfast.
author: michael c.

description: Eww... cold eggs are gross.  I NEVER send anything back, but this was just inedible.  BOOOOO!
author: Erica O.

description: Average breakfast place. Good service and atmosphere, average food. I got scrambled eggs and toast, the only thing I ever get for breakfast anywhere. I was pleased; good home fries. My brother ordered the Irish Breakfast and nearly had a heart attack before he even finished the meal. It was pretty grisly, and I don't know what the black and white puddings were but I think they involved organ meat. So, stick with what you know.
author: Kathleen B.

description:
Sucks.  While I was eating, I saw a cockroach waltz out from the espresso machine, and walk across it, then back in.

It was a baby cockroach.  I told my GF and she got that "petrified" look in her eye.  Good thing we weren't havning coffee.

Some middle-age loser was eating inside (the only person) while I was perusing the menu outside.  Said loser looks at me and starts giving an overly enthusiastic "thumbs up" signal, like the food is great.  

So that .... unfortunately sold me.  I hope karma serves that guy a cockroach coffee one of these days.
author: John K.

description: This place is a nice, laid back diner type spot. Not a gourmet place, but you can expect your usual breakfast food at decent prices. I personally get the blueberry pancake special every time I go there (pancakes, bacon or sausage and two eggs). They say it's only for weekdays, but if you ask nicely, they will make it for you anyway. And that's why I like this place, there is very little attitude. It's the type of place where you can relax, eat your food, drink your coffee, read the paper and enjoy a weekend morning. (works best when you sit at the counter, where you are less likely to be taking up prime real estate)
author: Tom H.

description:
WTF happened to this place?!?!  i am appalled by the service (or lack there of).  this used to be my favorite breakfast joint but i don't come by for a few months and the place has turned to doo-doo.  i ordered the shrimp avo cheeze omelet, the thing used to be so huge i had to take a break before finishing it ( i never let food go to waste).  but today, it was flat, have u seen a flat omelet? isn't it suppose to have some height or curve or something. it was as flat as my bf's blueberry pancake.  the home fried were ok, but a couple pieces tasted under cook.  my sourdough toast was under toasted and when i asked for butter, i didn't get it til the boyfriend marched himself up to the counter and asked the busboy to grab us some.  i also asked for a coffee refill that didn't come, which i myself had to walk up to the counter and point to the coffee pot and my cup for them to pour my another cup.  

i'm so sad, i can't go there no more.  =(

would have been a one star, but the blueberry pancakes were pretty good.
author: Ames K.

description: Irish breakfast for $9.99.  Thats all you need from rain tree cafe.  And based on the previous reviews, its the only food you need to order from here.  Good stuff!!!!
author: Kris A.

description: Great sandwiches with some really good fries. Ketchup wasn't too great. Had the fermentation taste to it. One side of my sandwich was a bit grese soggy while the other side was ok. Ah well..lunch is lunch right?
author: Jason C. J.

description: It's not the friendliest place.  ...but in that area...I believe it is one of the few places that have WAFFLES  (Believe me...my friend and I went searching for a place that had waffles by foot.  -- Darla's only has waffles once in a while)
author: Lise T.

description: It was twenty two dollars of disappointment.  But Art's, Howard's, or Irving Street can make you believe in breakfast again.
author: Dave K.

description: I went here with my husband and friends for brunch. Being vegan, my only option was really the veggie sandwich with no cheese or mayo, but that's fine--this is hardly a place you go for vegan food. The service was no-frills, but quick enough. The prices seemed a tad high, given that you can get better food (Chinese, Vietnamese or similar) for cheaper within a couple blocks. The home fries were soggy and bad. The coffee was kind of bad. Everyone else said the pancakes were fine.
author: Ramon E.

description: Reliable, standard Breakfast fare and at a very decent price.   Most dishes are well South of $10 and portions are generous but not obscenely large.   Had the shrimp, avocado and cheese omelette which included tasty breakfast potatoes and toast.  They also serve lunch and dinner and are well known for their hearty "Irish Breakfast".  Will definitely be back.
author: Todd K.

description: So far my dining experience here has been great! Great breakfast so far. This place can get packed pretty quickly! So go early..its first come first serve seating. The only negative thing that I would say is the wait staff aren't the most enthusiastic but it didn't affect the taste of the food.
author: andre h.

description: Check out their "Monster Burger" - don't be scared, its awesome! Over my two years living in the Bay Area, Raintree Cafe still has the best burger I have had here. I would give Raintree 5 stars except the inside of the cafe is in need of a make over and the service can sometimes be a little on the slow side.  However, there food is well worth it!  In addition to their burgers, their breakfasts are probably their primary strength.  Also, for the Vegetarians, Raintree has an excellent Veggie Burger that my friend loves.  The prices are reasonable as your meal will most likely cost you $8-$12.
author: Scott S.

description:
Cold foggy morning in the Sunset.  Too early for Irving cafe or Arts, so I gave this place a try.  Bad mistake.  Sausages undercooked, home fries steamed, bland, without any crusty crunch whatsoever.  Coffee not bad.
12 bucks with tip to escape out the door.  How can this place survive with so many better options on Irving?
author: Richard R.

description: Is there a "people hate us on Yelp" sticker?  Because Rain Tree could sure use one.  Both this location and the WP one have been absolutely ravaged by reviewers, both over the food and the service.  Ordinarily I would take Yelp at its word and stay far away, but I live only 4 blocks from this place now and it occupies a cute corner location.  So I decided that only personal experience would suffice to judge it.  The verdict?  Yes, there are several better diner-style breakfast options in the neighborhood (Art's and Irving St Cafe, for starters), I couldn't find anything particularly wrong with Rain Tree.  Since they make a big deal of their Irish Breakfast, I gave it a try, and it's certainly of fair quality and large portions.  So I'm not sure where all the hating comes from; heck, I could even see this being the perfect low-key fit for some of the locals.  But I take breakfast a little too seriously to be a regular here myself.
author: Wes M.

description:
it's just eh to me nothing stood out
service alright
parking is difficult there
didn't have sour cream for my omelette
author: M R.

description:
Um....well....everything was basically shite, and the authentic "Irish breakfast,' which was made by an authentic Hispanic man, served by an authentic Hispanic woman was baffling in it's mediocrity. We literally were just walking by and stopped in. They make an attempt at blood pudding, and a poor attempt at that, it tasted like a hot dog basically. Just look at the picture for this place on Yelp!! really!? that plate was the best representation of your skills? It looks like something out of A Denny's in Arkansas! It's cheap and whatever, but I just can't justify eating anywhere shitty when the city is so full of heavenly food. Next time I'm just gonna cab over to The Phoenix Bar who make a killer authentic Irish breakfast (though there it's served by an authentic Russian girl who plays the Stone Roses nonstop, but has a really cute ass) or Dotti's True Blue, wait in line and eavesdrop on hipster conversations, and have a stellar breakfast. 

And to top it off there were like two jocky kinda guys behind us and I think I heard them use the word 'fag,' about twenty times, and one of them had a tribal band tattoo, which is the sign of a guy who probably masturbates to comic books and wears backwards baseball caps and finds Adam Sandler movies hilarious!!
author: Steve l.

description:
The setting of the whole place was just awful! The place looked run down. The chairs were old looking, uncomfortable and the sun was shining right in our faces.. awesome.

The food was awful. Portions were small and quality was subpar. I ordered the Belgian Waffle. For $6, I'd better be getting something delicious and filling. Nope, just a plate of one waffle which tasted like it came right out the freezer.

If I wanted waffles like the one I was served here, I would've took that $6, head over to Safeway and buy a box of Eggos and a bottle of syrup.
author: Kon L.

description:
i will not eat here again. the servers seemed miserable and they were not very attentive.  the food was flavorless... the homefries were no better than eating raw potatoes, the scrambled eggs were more like one overcooked EGG. a 5 year old could have thrown together breakfast better than theirs.

although, the waffle was satisfactory, and waffles are hard to find in this city. there was also no wait (gee, i wonder why)... but still, not enough reasons to go back.

if you want good breakfast, go to all you knead on haight. i work there. it's good.
author: Renee L.

description: The banana pancakes were pretty good, but I dock them a star for their chalky overcooked bacon. Why go for a mediocre breakfast when there are so many better options in the city?
author: LadyLongLegs L.

description:
We were in there early one morning (8:15) and went there because our favorite (Irving St. Cafe) was closed!

I keep trying to like this place and I just don't. I've had breakfast there 2x in the past couple of months. Food is mediocre, service is without any heart. I ordered eggs one time & a sandwich another time. Really average food. 

We were one of two tables of customers & we STILL didn't get coffee poured. Asked for extra napkins...she never came back. Little things like that are a drag at breakfast time.

And why oh why can't ANYONE seem to understand a request for crispy potatoes??? They couldn't either.

Try Irving St. Cafe or Art's Cafe for a much better meal and experience.
author: Dee B.

description: A decent breakfast place. My choices as a non-meat eater are somewhat limited though...
author: fumiko t.

description: For a diner, Rain Tree offers a great menu selection. Looking for a burger? You got it. Fancy omelette? Sure. Delicious banana pancakes? Oh yeah. The service is fast, there's never a wait, and you can watch soccer on TV if you sit at the bar. The corner location makes for great people watching.
author: Ariel G.

description: someone at a party up the street told me to come here, they make really good "breakfastses." ok, so I have some real issues with bad grammar. one of the first words a baby learns is 'breakfast,' as in do you want cheerios for breakfast or would you like an egg for breakfast. so whatever. we were in need of some fatty comfort after a night of tormenting our livers. lip-smacking good ! try the pancakes, fluffy discs of delight. the man's bacon & eggs were good too but then again you've got to be completely inept to screw up bacon & eggs. would we come back for more breakfastses ? for sure, especially to soothe our aching cirrhotic livers. which is worse, cirrhosis or fatty liver ? discuss
author: Prima D.

description: First timers.  Good coffee, omelet, .blueberrie pancakes.  Prices are right.  We'll go back.
author: fred b.

description: They would get one more star if the waitress wasn't so spaced out!  I have eaten here twice.  Kudos to the cook for turning out consistently decent breakfast, pancakes, bacon eggs over medium (and there's not many place with truly decent panceakes consistently here).  But both times the waitress overcharged us and got the order wrong.  Cannot fill up the coffee, forgets syrup with pancakes, etc.  You have to chase her down to get anything and she forgets everything and doesn't seem to know the menu.  But still...good pancakes.
author: oyefunke a.

description: i guess if you want to pay $10 for 'Irish' breakfast, go for it. otherwise theres better places that are throwing distance from here.
author: Greg A.

description: I used to live in this neighborhood for 8 yrs and Raintree was one of my fav breakfast places, but it's changed owners since.  On a whim, we decided to eat here on Memorial Day because Art's Cafe was closed.  What a sad mistake. We sat for over 15 mins before the one guy behind the counter (no other wait person) brought us a menu, right about when we were ready to get up and leave.  The 2nd wait person finally arrived at 10am and it was clear they were understaffed for the holiday breakfast crowd.   The food was a sad comparison to the past.  My corned beef hash was outta a can (I can do this at home!) but the over easy eggs were done just right, oozing creamy yolks over the hash when pierced.  It came with 2 slices of wheat bread (my choice) and disgusting diced potatoes, whiter than my cupboards.  Did the cook even bother to cook it long enough?  It had this semi-stale after taste so I left it on my plate, untouched.  What's even sadder is that you couldn't catch the attention of the 2 wait persons.  The table next to us got up & paid at the counter, dead tired of waiting for the check.  We had to do the same.  Couldn't even get a 2nd coffee refill because they don't bother to scan the room to see what the customers need.  Adios, Raintree, service is bad enough that my hard earned money can take a hike elsewhere.
author: Ry T.

description: breakfast is nothing out of the ordinary, will not wait in a line during the weekend for this place...a lot cleaner than the west portal location...
author: Jenniflava R.

description: It's a cute little diner spot.  We randomly come here for brunch on sundays and ask to sit at the bar.  The omelettes are yummy but nothing really special about the place.  I feel that if you are going for the diner feeling, then really go with it and play up the space more.  A good thing is I've never had to wait to be seated and food is made on the spot and fast.
author: Mary H.

description: my last memory of this place was brunch, my friend ordering a milk shake, and receiving milk in a glass (perhaps she shook it), complaining that she ordered a milk shake, the waitress proclaiming it AS a milkshake, and then not taking it off the bill when it came time to pay.
author: william c.

description: Bleh.  I had an eggs benedict dish, minus the hollandaise, that was short of disgusting.  A soggy english muffin, poached egg made in old water, a slice of overripe tomato, a SLICE of cheddar cheese, dusted with parmesan and dried parsley.  Served with tasteless potatoes.  All for a hard-hitting $8.25.  My diner tasting coffee was $1.60.  My gf had the french toast, which was average, but priced a little better at $5.25 (I think).  She liked her milkshake, which was just under $4.  I'll never go there again.  For good, cheap diner food, I'll just go around the corner to M's.
author: Jack O.
